_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=11715, end=11727, entitycategory=LOCATION), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=11694, end=11704, sentimentcategory=4), begin=11715, end=11727, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: We had reached the zenith of man 's Ultima Thule , which had been sought for more than three centuries .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=12325, end=12333, entitycategory=LOCATION), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=12306, end=12324, sentimentcategory=3), begin=12325, end=12333, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: My object was to have a slightly different position for subsequent observations .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=12494, end=12497, entitycategory=LAND_COVER), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=12488, end=12493, sentimentcategory=3), begin=12494, end=12497, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: Placing our tent , bags and camp equipment on a sled , we pushed it over the ice field , crossed a narrow lead sheeted with young ice , and moved on to another field which seemed to have much greater dimensions .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=12995, end=13001, entitycategory=NAT_LANDFORM), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=12977, end=12982, sentimentcategory=4), begin=12995, end=13001, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: Here the newly-formed sheets of ice slid over each other as the great , ponderous fields stirred to and fro .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=12995, end=13001, entitycategory=NAT_LANDFORM), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=12985, end=12994, sentimentcategory=4), begin=12995, end=13001, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: Here the newly-formed sheets of ice slid over each other as the great , ponderous fields stirred to and fro .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=13232, end=13235, entitycategory=LAND_COVER), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=13228, end=13231, sentimentcategory=2), begin=13232, end=13235, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: Lying down , and putting my fur-cushioned ear to the edge of the old ice , I heard a distant thundering noise , the reverberations of the moving , grinding pack , which , by its wind-driven sweep , was drifting over the unseen seas of mystery .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=NULL, begin=14163, end=14207, entitycategory=LAND_COVER, sentimentcategory=4), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=14210, end=14318, sentimentcategory=5), begin=14163, end=14207, linktype=sentiment_of)
text: the nucleus for the origin of the polar pack
_sentence_text: In its making we have the nucleus for the origin of the polar pack , that great moving crust of the earth which crunches ships , grinds rocks , and sweeps mountains into the sea .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=14772, end=14785, entitycategory=NAT_PHENOMENON), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=14790, end=14796, sentimentcategory=4), begin=14772, end=14785, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: Another law of nature was solved by a similar insignificant incident .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=15447, end=15450, entitycategory=WEATHER), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=15440, end=15446, sentimentcategory=2), begin=15447, end=15450, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: The temperature was -41° ; we had felt no heat , but this black canvas had absorbed enough heat from a feeble sun to melt the snow beneath it .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=15669, end=15673, entitycategory=LAND_COVER), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=15674, end=15679, sentimentcategory=3), begin=15669, end=15673, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: As the long , tedious marches were made , I asked myself the questions : Why is snow white ?

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=15693, end=15696, entitycategory=WEATHER), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=15697, end=15701, sentimentcategory=3), begin=15693, end=15696, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: Why is the sky blue ?

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=16985, end=17032, entitycategory=NAT_PHENOMENON), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=16976, end=16984, sentimentcategory=3), begin=16985, end=17032, linktype=sentiment_of)
text: uniformity in the temperature of the atmosphere
_sentence_text: Although this difference had vanished now , the mind at times refused to grasp the remarkable change . [ 16 ] At the Pole I was impressed by a peculiar uniformity in the temperature of the atmosphere throughout the twenty-four hours , and also by a strange monotone in color and light of sea and sky .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=17090, end=17132, entitycategory=NAT_PHENOMENON), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=17082, end=17089, sentimentcategory=3), begin=17090, end=17132, linktype=sentiment_of)
text: monotone in color and light of sea and sky
_sentence_text: Although this difference had vanished now , the mind at times refused to grasp the remarkable change . [ 16 ] At the Pole I was impressed by a peculiar uniformity in the temperature of the atmosphere throughout the twenty-four hours , and also by a strange monotone in color and light of sea and sky .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=NULL, begin=17211, end=17240, entitycategory=NAT_PHENOMENON, sentimentcategory=3), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=17203, end=17210, sentimentcategory=3), begin=17211, end=17240, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: The strange equability of light and color , of humidity and of air temperatures extended an area one hundred miles about the Pole .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=17767, end=17778, entitycategory=NAT_PHENOMENON), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=17779, end=17811, sentimentcategory=4), begin=17767, end=17778, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: At the Pole the thermometer did not rise or fall appreciably for certain fixed hours of the day or night , but remained almost uniform during the entire twenty-four hours .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=17767, end=17778, entitycategory=NAT_PHENOMENON), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=17871, end=17885, sentimentcategory=3), begin=17767, end=17778, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: At the Pole the thermometer did not rise or fall appreciably for certain fixed hours of the day or night , but remained almost uniform during the entire twenty-four hours .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=19135, end=19138, entitycategory=WEATHER), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=19087, end=19127, sentimentcategory=4), begin=19135, end=19138, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: In the region about the Pole I observed that , although there were remarkable and beauteous color blendings in the sky , the intense contrasts and the spectacular display of cloud effects , seen in more southern regions , were absent .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=19183, end=19207, entitycategory=NAT_PHENOMENON), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=19145, end=19182, sentimentcategory=5), begin=19183, end=19207, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: In the region about the Pole I observed that , although there were remarkable and beauteous color blendings in the sky , the intense contrasts and the spectacular display of cloud effects , seen in more southern regions , were absent .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=19256, end=19273, entitycategory=NAT_PHENOMENON), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=19277, end=19283, sentimentcategory=3), begin=19256, end=19273, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: A color suffusion is common throughout the entire Arctic zone .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=19320, end=19325, entitycategory=NAT_PHENOMENON), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=19390, end=19412, sentimentcategory=4), begin=19320, end=19325, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: Light , pouring from the low-lying sun , is reflected from the ice in an indescribable blaze .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=19480, end=19499, entitycategory=NAT_PHENOMENON), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=19502, end=19575, sentimentcategory=4), begin=19480, end=19499, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: From millions of ice slopes , with millions and millions of tiny reflecting surfaces , each one a mirror , some large , some smaller than specks of diamond dust , this light is sent back in different directions in burning waves to the sky .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=19817, end=19820, entitycategory=LAND_COVER), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=19855, end=19933, sentimentcategory=4), begin=19817, end=19820, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: Sometimes the ice and air and sky are suffused with a hue of rose , again of orange , again of a light alloyed yellow , again blue ; and , as we get farther north , more dominantly purple .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=19817, end=19820, entitycategory=LAND_COVER), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=19968, end=19990, sentimentcategory=4), begin=19817, end=19820, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: Sometimes the ice and air and sky are suffused with a hue of rose , again of orange , again of a light alloyed yellow , again blue ; and , as we get farther north , more dominantly purple .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=19825, end=19828, entitycategory=NAT_PHENOMENON), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=19855, end=19933, sentimentcategory=4), begin=19825, end=19828, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: Sometimes the ice and air and sky are suffused with a hue of rose , again of orange , again of a light alloyed yellow , again blue ; and , as we get farther north , more dominantly purple .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=19825, end=19828, entitycategory=NAT_PHENOMENON), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=19968, end=19990, sentimentcategory=4), begin=19825, end=19828, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: Sometimes the ice and air and sky are suffused with a hue of rose , again of orange , again of a light alloyed yellow , again blue ; and , as we get farther north , more dominantly purple .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=19833, end=19836, entitycategory=NAT_PHENOMENON), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=19855, end=19933, sentimentcategory=4), begin=19833, end=19836, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: Sometimes the ice and air and sky are suffused with a hue of rose , again of orange , again of a light alloyed yellow , again blue ; and , as we get farther north , more dominantly purple .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=19833, end=19836, entitycategory=NAT_PHENOMENON), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=19968, end=19990, sentimentcategory=4), begin=19833, end=19836, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: Sometimes the ice and air and sky are suffused with a hue of rose , again of orange , again of a light alloyed yellow , again blue ; and , as we get farther north , more dominantly purple .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=20050, end=20063, entitycategory=NAT_PHENOMENON), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=20075, end=20102, sentimentcategory=4), begin=20050, end=20063, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: Farther south , in our journey northward , we had viewed color effects in reality incomparably more beautiful than those in the regions about the Pole .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=20150, end=20153, entitycategory=NAT_PHENOMENON), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=20345, end=20383, sentimentcategory=4), begin=20150, end=20153, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: The sun , farther south , in rising and setting , and with limitless changes of polarized and refracted light , passing through strata of atmosphere of varying depths of different density , produces kaleidoscopic changes of burning color . [ Illustration : FIRST CAMP AT THE POLE , APRIL 21 , 1908 ] [ Illustration : AT THE POLE -- '' WE WERE THE ONLY PULSATING CREATURES IN A DEAD WORLD OF ICE '' ] At the Pole there were sunbursts , but because of the slight change in the sun 's dip to the horizon , the prevailing light was invariably in shades running to purple .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=20653, end=20669, entitycategory=NAT_PHENOMENON), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=20688, end=20712, sentimentcategory=4), begin=20653, end=20669, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: The sun , farther south , in rising and setting , and with limitless changes of polarized and refracted light , passing through strata of atmosphere of varying depths of different density , produces kaleidoscopic changes of burning color . [ Illustration : FIRST CAMP AT THE POLE , APRIL 21 , 1908 ] [ Illustration : AT THE POLE -- '' WE WERE THE ONLY PULSATING CREATURES IN A DEAD WORLD OF ICE '' ] At the Pole there were sunbursts , but because of the slight change in the sun 's dip to the horizon , the prevailing light was invariably in shades running to purple .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=NULL, begin=20882, end=20899, entitycategory=NAT_PHENOMENON, sentimentcategory=2), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=20900, end=20927, sentimentcategory=1), begin=20882, end=20899, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: At first my imagination evoked a more glowing wonder than in reality existed ; as the hours wore on , and as the wants of my body asserted themselves , I began to see the vacant spaces with a disillusionizing eye .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=24346, end=24353, entitycategory=NAT_PHENOMENON), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=24354, end=24393, sentimentcategory=3), begin=24346, end=24353, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: In our northward progress -- to explain my shadow observations from the beginning -- for a long time after our start from Svartevoeg , our shadows did not perceptibly shorten or brighten , to my eyes .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=24644, end=24649, entitycategory=NAT_LANDFORM), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=24638, end=24643, sentimentcategory=4), begin=24644, end=24649, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: Far from land , far from every sign of a cheering , solid earth , wandering with our shadows over the hopeless desolation of the moving seas of glitter , I , too , took a keen interest in the blue blots that represented our bodies .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=24644, end=24649, entitycategory=NAT_LANDFORM), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=24627, end=24635, sentimentcategory=4), begin=24644, end=24649, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: Far from land , far from every sign of a cheering , solid earth , wandering with our shadows over the hopeless desolation of the moving seas of glitter , I , too , took a keen interest in the blue blots that represented our bodies .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=24862, end=24866, entitycategory=NAT_PHENOMENON), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=24872, end=24912, sentimentcategory=3), begin=24862, end=24866, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: At noon , by comparison with later hours , they were sharp , short , of a dark , restful blue .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=24990, end=25007, entitycategory=NAT_PHENOMENON), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=25008, end=25069, sentimentcategory=2), begin=24990, end=25007, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: At this time a thick atmosphere of crystals rested upon the ice pack , and when the sun sank the strongest purple rays could not penetrate the frosty haze .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=25131, end=25134, entitycategory=NAT_PHENOMENON), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=25139, end=25177, sentimentcategory=2), begin=25131, end=25134, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: Long before the time for sunset , even on clear days , the sun was lost in low clouds of drifting needles . [ Illustration : SHADOW-CIRCLES INDICATING THE APPROACH TO THE POLE Shadow-circle about 250 miles from the Pole .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=NULL, begin=25950, end=25968, entitycategory=NAT_PHENOMENON, sentimentcategory=3), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=25975, end=26028, sentimentcategory=2), begin=25950, end=25968, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: The positive blue grew to a permanent purple , and the sharp outlines ran to vague , indeterminate edges .

_sentence_text: Coarse grey mud , superficial layer more liquid and brown .

text: The lower part of its sides
_sentence_text: The lower part of its sides is steep and rocky , though not too steep for the growth of tamarisk scrub and much herbage , but above are prodigious conglomerate cliffs , and below , the river , which narrows to a stream , is concealed by enormous masses of conglomerate rock .

_sentence_text: Arjanak has been built for security on some narrow ledges below these colossal walls .

_sentence_text: It is a mere eyrie , a collection of rude stone hovels , one above the other , among which the Khan 's house is distinguishable only by its _balakhana_ and larger size .

_sentence_text: The paths on the dusty hillside are so narrow and shelving that I needed a helping hand as well as a stick to enable me to reach a small , oblong , rug-covered platform under some willow trees , where Mirab Khan received me , with a very repulsive-looking Seyyid scribe seated by him in front of a _samovar_ and tea equipage , from which he produced delicious tea , flavoured with lime-juice .

_sentence_text: Unfortunately , in one of the many attempted fights among the horses , _Screw_ kicked her on the chest and fore-leg a few days ago , which has made a quarrel between Hadji , _Screw's_ owner , and Aziz .

_sentence_text: Now Aziz is making me a slave to his animal .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=6695, end=6699, entitycategory=PERSON), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=6707, end=6713, sentimentcategory=2), begin=6695, end=6699, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: Mirab Khan had promised that not only guides but his son would accompany the Agha , but when I arrived at his eyrie the next morning it was evident that something was wrong , for the Agha looked gloomy , and Mirab Khan uncomfortable , and as I was dressing the wound of the snake-bitten man , the former said , `` So far as I can see , we are in a perfect hornets ' nest . '' Neither son nor guides were forthcoming .

_sentence_text: We left Diz Arjanak rather late in the afternoon , ascended a valley which opens out beyond it , forded the green bright waters of the Mauri Zarin , and crossed beautiful open hillsides and elevated plateaux on its right bank till we lost it in a highly picturesque gorge .

_sentence_text: Some miles of very pleasant riding brought us to a rocky and dangerous path along the side of a precipice above the river Badush , so narrow as to involve the unloading of several mules , and a bad slip and narrow escape on the part of mine .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=9725, end=9731, entitycategory=NAT_LANDFORM), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=9718, end=9724, sentimentcategory=2), begin=9725, end=9731, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: Crossing the Badush , and ascending a narrow ravine through which it flows , we camped at its source at the junction of two wild gullies , where the Sahib , after sundry serious risks , had already arrived .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=9809, end=9816, entitycategory=NAT_LANDFORM), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=9804, end=9808, sentimentcategory=3), begin=9809, end=9816, linktype=sentiment_of)

_sentence_text: Camp Badush , at a height of 9100 feet , though shut in by high mountains , was cool -- a barren , rocky , treeless spot .

_sentence_text: A great deal of bituminous shale was lying about , which burned in the camp-fires fairly well , but with a black heavy smoke and a strong smell .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=10864, end=10870, entitycategory=NAT_LANDFORM), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=10851, end=10856, sentimentcategory=4), begin=10864, end=10870, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: After a restful halt we retraced our route by a low path which avoided the difficult precipices above the Badush , forded it several times , crossed a low pass , descended to the valley of the Mauri Zarin , forded the river , and marched for some miles along its left bank , till the valley opened on great grassy slopes , the skirts of the rocky spurs which buttress the grand mountain Shuturun , the '' Camel Mountain , '' so called from its shape .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=10928, end=10945, entitycategory=NAT_LANDFORM), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=10922, end=10927, sentimentcategory=4), begin=10928, end=10945, linktype=sentiment_of)

_sentence_text: FOOTNOTES : [ 6 ] A `` Diz '' is a natural fort believed to be impregnable . [ 7 ] To English people the Bakhtiaris profess great friendliness for England , and the opinion has been expressed by some well-informed writers that , in the event of an English occupation of the country , their light horse , drilled by English officers , would prove valuable auxiliaries .

_sentence_text: Yesterday we marched through narrow defiles and along hillsides to this lake , without seeing a tent , a man , or even a sheep or goat , following a stream which bears several names and receives several torrents which burst , full grown , from powerful springs in the mountain sides -- a frequent phenomenon in this country -- from its source till its entrance into this lake .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=17598, end=17603, entitycategory=NAT_LANDFORM), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=17620, end=17627, sentimentcategory=4), begin=17598, end=17603, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: On the right bank rise the magnificent ranges which form Shuturun , broken up into precipices , deep ravines , and peaks , all rocky and shapely , and absolutely denuded of soil .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=18035, end=18045, entitycategory=FLORA), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=18027, end=18034, sentimentcategory=2), begin=18035, end=18045, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: The mountains on the left bank are great shapeless masses of bare gravel rising into the high but blunt summit of the Sefid Kuh , with only occasional outcrops of rock ; here and there among the crevices of the rocky spurs of Shuturun the _Juniperus excelsa_ plants itself ; otherwise , on the sun-scorched gravel only low tamarisk bushes , yellow salvias , a few belated campanulas , and a very lovely blue _Trichodesma mollis_ remain .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=18072, end=18090, entitycategory=FLORA), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=18052, end=18070, sentimentcategory=5), begin=18072, end=18090, linktype=sentiment_of)

_sentence_text: Were a pea transparent , vivid , full of points and flashes of interior light , that would be the nearest approach to the colour , which changes never , while through the blazing hours the blue of the great depths in the centre has altered from sapphire to turquoise , and from turquoise to lapis-lazuli , one end and one side being permanently bordered round the margin with liquid emerald .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=20640, end=20645, entitycategory=FLORA), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=20635, end=20639, sentimentcategory=4), begin=20640, end=20645, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: A blazing hillside ; a mountain of gravel among others of similar ugliness , sprinkled with camel thorn and thistles ; a steep and long descent to a stream ; ripe wheat on some irrigated slopes ; above these the hundred hovels of the village of Sarawand clinging one above another to the hillside , their white clay roofs intolerable in the fierce light ; more scorched gravel hills breaking off abruptly , and then a blazing plain , in a mist of dust and heat , and low hills on the farther side seen through a brown haze , make up the view from my tent .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=20825, end=20830, entitycategory=NAT_PHENOMENON), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=20818, end=20824, sentimentcategory=4), begin=20825, end=20830, linktype=sentiment_of)

_sentence_text: The _ketchuda_ said if I would stand outside and show myself the people would be pacified , but the desired result was not attained , and the crushing and pushing were fearful -- not that the people here or elsewhere are ever rude , it is simply that their curiosity is not restrained by those rules which govern ours .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=22450, end=22453, entitycategory=PERSON), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=22399, end=22403, sentimentcategory=3), begin=22450, end=22453, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: _Camp Parwez , July 31._ -- We left early in the morning , _en route_ for the fort of Yahya Khan , the powerful chief of the Pulawand tribe , with a tall , well-dressed , and very respectable-looking man , Bagha Khan , one of his many fathers-in-law , the father of the present `` reigning favourite , '' as guide .

_sentence_text: But in the noise and confusion of embarking on certain transports taking us to the railway on the main land , she seems to have lost her head as well as her charge , and I recall that I found myself wandering alone among the vast spaces of Castle Garden and the docks .

_sentence_text: Among the men who undertook to receive this large company in their homes and to help them get established in homes of their own , and who extended the glad hand of welcome that day , should be mentioned these : Stingrim Hinseth , Ingebricht Fagerhaugh , Haldo Saether , John Rye , John Aalbu and Halvor Hinseth .

_sentence_text: These points of light were , of course , fire flies , so called , or certain phosphorescent bugs which at that time were very numerous because of the abundant grass prevailing everywhere .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=7765, end=7772, entitycategory=BIOME), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=7776, end=7797, sentimentcategory=4), begin=7765, end=7772, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: But back of the creek bottom where these earliest homesteaders had located was the far stretching open prairie -- a sea of waving grass -- with a lonely dug-out only here and there and vast stretches of '' no man 's land '' between .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=7765, end=7772, entitycategory=BIOME), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=7745, end=7759, sentimentcategory=4), begin=7765, end=7772, linktype=sentiment_of)

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=8226, end=8230, entitycategory=FLORA), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=8210, end=8225, sentimentcategory=4), begin=8226, end=8230, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: There is today many a waving field of corn and grain where we boys of the first generation of settlers once launched our home made boats , hunted ducks , swam and occasionally came near drowning .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=8411, end=8417, entitycategory=HUM_LANDFORM), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=8389, end=8403, sentimentcategory=4), begin=8411, end=8417, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: The best travelled of the trails in the part of the country we are describing was the old territorial trail called the Sioux Falls Road .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=8626, end=8634, entitycategory=HUM_LANDFORM), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=8656, end=8677, sentimentcategory=4), begin=8626, end=8634, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: This angled in a north-easterly direction all the way from Yankton to Sioux Falls , and many a prairie schooner could be seen moving with stately slowness over this road , not to speak of other vehicles which were numerous .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=9215, end=9221, entitycategory=FAUNA), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=9222, end=9246, sentimentcategory=4), begin=9215, end=9221, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: There were no wire fences to mark boundaries between farms or to form pastures in those days , and the cattle were herded far and wide .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=10919, end=10928, entitycategory=HUM_LANDFORM), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=10940, end=10973, sentimentcategory=4), begin=10919, end=10928, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: The sod house was a more advanced and perhaps more stylish dwelling .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=11046, end=11051, entitycategory=HUM_LANDFORM), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=11091, end=11125, sentimentcategory=4), begin=11046, end=11051, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: Closely related to the sod house was the mud house where the walls , about two or three feet thick , were made of well tramped mud and straw .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=11134, end=11144, entitycategory=HUM_LANDFORM), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=11175, end=11208, sentimentcategory=4), begin=11134, end=11144, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: These mud houses were at times whitewashed and were both comfortable and sightly .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=11261, end=11270, entitycategory=HUM_LANDFORM), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=11276, end=11306, sentimentcategory=4), begin=11261, end=11270, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: As for comfort in the cold winter the dug-out and sod house were not so bad when properly built .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=11491, end=11496, entitycategory=HUM_LANDFORM), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=11516, end=11575, sentimentcategory=4), begin=11491, end=11496, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: A house made of lumber was a luxury which many an early settler had to look forward to for many a hard , long year , and often he had to die in the dug-out or sod shanty .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=11648, end=11658, entitycategory=HUM_LANDFORM), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=11606, end=11632, sentimentcategory=1), begin=11648, end=11658, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: A house made of lumber was a luxury which many an early settler had to look forward to for many a hard , long year , and often he had to die in the dug-out or sod shanty .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=11775, end=11780, entitycategory=HUM_LANDFORM), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=11853, end=11906, sentimentcategory=4), begin=11775, end=11780, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: This type of house put one in the class of the most well-to-do ; and such a habitation was the hope and dream of years for many a pilgrim mother of those days .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=11775, end=11780, entitycategory=HUM_LANDFORM), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=11789, end=11824, sentimentcategory=4), begin=11775, end=11780, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: This type of house put one in the class of the most well-to-do ; and such a habitation was the hope and dream of years for many a pilgrim mother of those days .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=12264, end=12269, entitycategory=FLORA), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=12242, end=12260, sentimentcategory=2), begin=12264, end=12269, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: What could these men -- farmers and men of trades -- do in this howling wilderness of grass , grass and nothing but grass ?

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=12294, end=12299, entitycategory=FLORA), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=12282, end=12293, sentimentcategory=2), begin=12294, end=12299, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: What could these men -- farmers and men of trades -- do in this howling wilderness of grass , grass and nothing but grass ?

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=12336, end=12346, entitycategory=FAUNA), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=12359, end=12373, sentimentcategory=2), begin=12336, end=12346, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: Yes , there was something else -- mosquitoes -- and oh , how they stung !

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=12381, end=12386, entitycategory=FAUNA), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=12397, end=12475, sentimentcategory=2), begin=12381, end=12386, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: Also flies , and how incessantly and mercilessly they attacked the fair soft skin of these pilgrims from the Norseland !

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=12870, end=12875, entitycategory=FLORA), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=12801, end=12866, sentimentcategory=2), begin=12870, end=12875, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: Shoes were bought ; houses were of sod or earth and needed no paint ; years would be required to make cultivated fields out of this sea of grass , and meanwhile they and their families must somehow live .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=13193, end=13200, entitycategory=HUM_LANDFORM), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=13177, end=13192, sentimentcategory=2), begin=13193, end=13200, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: The dwellings were small , without cooling porches , and in summer necessarily hot , and they had no screens to protect the inmates from the blood-thirsty fly and mosquito .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=13305, end=13308, entitycategory=FAUNA), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=13291, end=13304, sentimentcategory=2), begin=13305, end=13308, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: The dwellings were small , without cooling porches , and in summer necessarily hot , and they had no screens to protect the inmates from the blood-thirsty fly and mosquito .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=13313, end=13321, entitycategory=FAUNA), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=13291, end=13304, sentimentcategory=2), begin=13313, end=13321, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: The dwellings were small , without cooling porches , and in summer necessarily hot , and they had no screens to protect the inmates from the blood-thirsty fly and mosquito .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=13961, end=13968, entitycategory=HUM_LANDFORM), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=13988, end=14065, sentimentcategory=4), begin=13961, end=13968, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: But this I do know , that now I have no money either to take myself or any of you back again . '' `` Then , '' rejoined the first one , `` if now I could stand on the highway where we started , even with nothing but a shirt on my back , I should be the happiest man alive . '' Another said : `` There is not even grass here such as one can cut with a scythe and , as for land I shall have none of it . '' And in his case it became so .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=14107, end=14112, entitycategory=FLORA), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=14098, end=14106, sentimentcategory=2), begin=14107, end=14112, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: But this I do know , that now I have no money either to take myself or any of you back again . '' `` Then , '' rejoined the first one , `` if now I could stand on the highway where we started , even with nothing but a shirt on my back , I should be the happiest man alive . '' Another said : `` There is not even grass here such as one can cut with a scythe and , as for land I shall have none of it . '' And in his case it became so .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=14729, end=14741, entitycategory=PERSON), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=14823, end=14888, sentimentcategory=2), begin=14729, end=14741, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: Father tried to take a brighter view and to cheer those complaining ones and said to Iver Sneve , who had just expressed the wish to be back on the old sod : `` In three years you will be butchering your own pork , raised on your farm in this new land . '' Then Iver broke out into his characteristically loud , uproarious laughter , full of incredulity and almost scorn , and said : `` Berhaug Rise , I have up till this time considered you a man of sense and good judgment , but now I am compelled to believe that your mind 's eye is shimmering .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=14729, end=14741, entitycategory=PERSON), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=14744, end=14816, sentimentcategory=4), begin=14729, end=14741, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: Father tried to take a brighter view and to cheer those complaining ones and said to Iver Sneve , who had just expressed the wish to be back on the old sod : `` In three years you will be butchering your own pork , raised on your farm in this new land . '' Then Iver broke out into his characteristically loud , uproarious laughter , full of incredulity and almost scorn , and said : `` Berhaug Rise , I have up till this time considered you a man of sense and good judgment , but now I am compelled to believe that your mind 's eye is shimmering .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=15039, end=15044, entitycategory=FAUNA), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=15066, end=15104, sentimentcategory=1), begin=15039, end=15044, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: Unless some one takes pity on me and helps me to return home , the flies and mosquitoes alone will have finished me before that time .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=15049, end=15059, entitycategory=FAUNA), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=15066, end=15104, sentimentcategory=1), begin=15049, end=15059, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: Unless some one takes pity on me and helps me to return home , the flies and mosquitoes alone will have finished me before that time .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=15986, end=15989, entitycategory=WEATHER), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=15982, end=15985, sentimentcategory=2), begin=15986, end=15989, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: But ten hours a day , in the hot sun and with an Irish boss over them to see that these implements kept constantly moving , was no soft initiation for these fair skinned men just out of a much colder climate .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=16797, end=16801, entitycategory=WEATHER), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=16792, end=16796, sentimentcategory=2), begin=16797, end=16801, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: And the deep snow never left until nearly the middle of April , when the big flood of 1881 resulted .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=16861, end=16866, entitycategory=NAT_PHENOMENON), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=16857, end=16860, sentimentcategory=2), begin=16861, end=16866, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: And the deep snow never left until nearly the middle of April , when the big flood of 1881 resulted .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=17446, end=17458, entitycategory=FLORA), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=17512, end=17574, sentimentcategory=4), begin=17446, end=17458, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: But if it had not been for the old oaken stumps and the warm woolen clothes we had brought with us , it is hard to see how we could have survived that first winter .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=19287, end=19295, entitycategory=FAUNA), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=19227, end=19267, sentimentcategory=2), begin=19287, end=19295, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: But this combination did not prove a success , for whenever the chickens fell down or ventured down to their room mates below , they were eaten up by the pigs .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=19377, end=19381, entitycategory=FAUNA), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=19227, end=19267, sentimentcategory=2), begin=19377, end=19381, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: But this combination did not prove a success , for whenever the chickens fell down or ventured down to their room mates below , they were eaten up by the pigs .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=19996, end=20003, entitycategory=FAUNA), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=19991, end=19995, sentimentcategory=2), begin=19996, end=20003, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: It was well that the ropes were new and fairly long , for it took three days of both brave and skilled maneuvering to get these wild animals of the plains to the home of their new masters .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=21404, end=21406, entitycategory=FAUNA), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=21411, end=21502, sentimentcategory=4), begin=21404, end=21406, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: But it was after all the ox who really helped subdue the soil and lay the foundations for farming and prosperity in general .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=22101, end=22108, entitycategory=BIOME), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=22096, end=22100, sentimentcategory=2), begin=22101, end=22108, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: If any one should get the impression from this seemingly one-sided treatment that pioneer mothers bore any lesser part of the burdens and sacrifices incident to leaving the land of their birth , and beginning all over again the long struggle of re-establishing themselves , and that , too , on the bare prairie where there was absolutely nothing to begin with , such a one has been greatly misled .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=22101, end=22108, entitycategory=BIOME), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=22109, end=22157, sentimentcategory=2), begin=22101, end=22108, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: If any one should get the impression from this seemingly one-sided treatment that pioneer mothers bore any lesser part of the burdens and sacrifices incident to leaving the land of their birth , and beginning all over again the long struggle of re-establishing themselves , and that , too , on the bare prairie where there was absolutely nothing to begin with , such a one has been greatly misled .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=22800, end=22807, entitycategory=BIOME), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=22793, end=22799, sentimentcategory=2), begin=22800, end=22807, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: Our mothers left their home relations , kindred and neighbors close around them , to be set down on a lonely prairie , cut off from all the dear relationships of childhood and womanhood .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=22800, end=22807, entitycategory=BIOME), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=22810, end=22876, sentimentcategory=2), begin=22800, end=22807, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: Our mothers left their home relations , kindred and neighbors close around them , to be set down on a lonely prairie , cut off from all the dear relationships of childhood and womanhood .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=24843, end=24847, entitycategory=FLORA), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=24862, end=24915, sentimentcategory=2), begin=24843, end=24847, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: It shall be said to their credit , too , that while most of the men of that day used the weed , few of them used it in such beastly excess as is often seen today .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=890, end=894, entitycategory=WEATHER), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=884, end=889, sentimentcategory=4), begin=890, end=894, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: The boats were now hoisted in , and we made sail to the west , with a brisk gale at east , which continued till the 9th , when we had for a few hours , a breeze at N.W. , attended with squalls of rain .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=1054, end=1058, entitycategory=WEATHER), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=1041, end=1053, sentimentcategory=4), begin=1054, end=1058, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: This was succeeded by a steady fresh gale at S.E. , with which we steered N.W. , being at this time in the latitude of 20° 20 ' S. longitude 176° 8 ' E.

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=1322, end=1326, entitycategory=WEATHER), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=1335, end=1348, sentimentcategory=2), begin=1322, end=1326, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: The next day the weather was foggy , and the wind blew in heavy squalls , attended with rain , which in this ocean , within the tropics , generally indicates the vicinity of some high land .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=2893, end=2896, entitycategory=NAT_LANDFORM), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=2886, end=2892, sentimentcategory=4), begin=2893, end=2896, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: The gale kept increasing till we were reduced to our low sails ; so that , on the 18th , at seven in the morning , I gave over plying , set the top-sails double-reefed , bore up for , and hauled round the north end of Aurora Island , and then stretched over for the Isle of Lepers , under close-reefed topsails and courses , with a very hard gale at N.E . ; but we had now the advantage of a smooth sea , having the Isle of Aurora to windward .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=3364, end=3381, entitycategory=NAT_LANDFORM), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=3354, end=3363, sentimentcategory=4), begin=3364, end=3381, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: We now saw people on the shore , and many beautiful cascades of water pouring down the neighbouring hills .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=6568, end=6574, entitycategory=WEATHER), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=6563, end=6567, sentimentcategory=4), begin=6568, end=6574, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: We now stood S.S.W. , with a fine breeze at S.E . ; and , at ten o'clock , discovered this part of the land to be an island , which is called by the natives Ambrym .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=8096, end=8103, entitycategory=PERSON), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=8135, end=8148, sentimentcategory=2), begin=8096, end=8103, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: We had no sooner anchored than several of the natives came off in canoes .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=8096, end=8103, entitycategory=PERSON), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=8176, end=8204, sentimentcategory=4), begin=8096, end=8103, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: We had no sooner anchored than several of the natives came off in canoes .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=9234, end=9240, entitycategory=PERSON), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=9342, end=9364, sentimentcategory=2), begin=9234, end=9240, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: A fellow in a canoe having been refused admittance into one of our boats that lay alongside , bent his bow to shoot a poisoned arrow at the boat-keeper .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=12044, end=12047, entitycategory=FAUNA), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=12140, end=12154, sentimentcategory=4), begin=12044, end=12047, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: The pig was not brought to be exchanged for what we had , but on some other account , probably as a peace-offering .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=14075, end=14090, entitycategory=FLORA), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=14097, end=14114, sentimentcategory=2), begin=14075, end=14090, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: There were , likewise , some bread-fruit , cocoa-nut , and plaintain trees ; but very little fruit on any of them .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=14149, end=14153, entitycategory=FLORA, sentimentcategory=4), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=14134, end=14148, sentimentcategory=4), begin=14149, end=14153, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: A good many fine yams were piled up upon sticks , or a kind of raised platform ; and about twenty pigs , and a few fowls , were running about loose .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=14794, end=14802, entitycategory=FLORA), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=14868, end=14875, sentimentcategory=2), begin=14794, end=14802, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: We found on the beach a fruit like an orange , called by them Abbimora ; but whether it be fit for eating , I can not say , as this was decayed . [ * Or Mallicolla .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=16169, end=16173, entitycategory=WEATHER), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=16156, end=16165, sentimentcategory=4), begin=16169, end=16173, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: Being unwilling to lose the benefit of the moon-light nights , which now happened , at seven a.m. on the 23d , we weighed ; and , with a light air of wind , and the assistance of our boats , proceeded out of the harbour , the south end of which , at noon , bore W.S.W. , distant about two miles .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=16325, end=16332, entitycategory=PERSON), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=16379, end=16416, sentimentcategory=4), begin=16325, end=16332, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: When the natives saw us under sail , they came off in canoes , making exchanges with more confidence than before , and giving such extraordinary proofs of their honesty as surprised us .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=16325, end=16332, entitycategory=PERSON), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=16447, end=16484, sentimentcategory=4), begin=16325, end=16332, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: When the natives saw us under sail , they came off in canoes , making exchanges with more confidence than before , and giving such extraordinary proofs of their honesty as surprised us .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=19245, end=19250, entitycategory=PERSON), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=19267, end=19293, sentimentcategory=2), begin=19245, end=19250, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: See Wafer 's Voyage , p . 140 . ] We saw but few women , and they were not less ugly than the men ; their heads , faces , and shoulders , are painted red ; they wear a kind of petticoat ; and some of them had something over their shoulders like a bag , in which they carry their children .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=21083, end=21103, entitycategory=PERSON), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=21119, end=21170, sentimentcategory=4), begin=21083, end=21103, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: The people of Mallicollo seemed to be a quite different nation from any we had yet met with , and speak a different language .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=21734, end=21740, entitycategory=FLORA), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=21745, end=21798, sentimentcategory=2), begin=21734, end=21740, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: To judge of the country by the little water we saw of it , it must be fertile ; but I believe their fruits are not so good as those of the Society or Friendly Isles .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=21860, end=21871, entitycategory=FLORA), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=21886, end=21910, sentimentcategory=2), begin=21860, end=21871, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: Their cocoa-nut trees , I am certain , are not ; and their bread-fruit and plantains did not seem much better .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=21876, end=21885, entitycategory=FLORA), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=21886, end=21910, sentimentcategory=2), begin=21876, end=21885, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: Their cocoa-nut trees , I am certain , are not ; and their bread-fruit and plantains did not seem much better .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=21923, end=21927, entitycategory=FLORA), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=21928, end=21952, sentimentcategory=4), begin=21923, end=21927, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: But their yams appeared to be very good .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=22122, end=22125, entitycategory=FAUNA), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=22204, end=22221, sentimentcategory=4), begin=22122, end=22125, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: They have not so much as a name for a dog , and consequently have none , for which reason we left them a dog and a bitch ; and there is no doubt they will be taken care of , as they were very fond of them .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=22132, end=22137, entitycategory=FAUNA), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=22204, end=22221, sentimentcategory=4), begin=22132, end=22137, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: They have not so much as a name for a dog , and consequently have none , for which reason we left them a dog and a bitch ; and there is no doubt they will be taken care of , as they were very fond of them .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=23649, end=23654, entitycategory=NAT_LANDFORM), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=23698, end=23743, sentimentcategory=4), begin=23649, end=23654, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: In the port , the depth of water is from twenty to four fathoms ; and it is so sheltered that no winds can disturb a ship at anchor there .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=1157, end=1165, entitycategory=LOCATION), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=1132, end=1149, sentimentcategory=4), begin=1157, end=1165, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: Following the numerous windings of the Missouri , from one chain of hills to another , we reached , at seven o'clock in the evening , the mouth of the Yellow Stone , a fine river , hardly inferior in breadth to the Missouri at this part .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=1269, end=1281, entitycategory=LOCATION), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=1284, end=1296, sentimentcategory=4), begin=1269, end=1281, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: Following the numerous windings of the Missouri , from one chain of hills to another , we reached , at seven o'clock in the evening , the mouth of the Yellow Stone , a fine river , hardly inferior in breadth to the Missouri at this part .

_sentence_text: Following the numerous windings of the Missouri , from one chain of hills to another , we reached , at seven o'clock in the evening , the mouth of the Yellow Stone , a fine river , hardly inferior in breadth to the Missouri at this part .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=1455, end=1462, entitycategory=FLORA), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=1437, end=1446, sentimentcategory=4), begin=1455, end=1462, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: It issues below the high grey chain of hills , and its mouth is bordered with a fine wood of tall poplars , with willow thickets .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=1843, end=1848, entitycategory=NAT_LANDFORM), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=1885, end=1898, sentimentcategory=4), begin=1843, end=1848, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: At the next turn of the river , towards the right hand , we had a fine prospect .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=1908, end=1917, entitycategory=NAT_LANDFORM), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=1901, end=1907, sentimentcategory=4), begin=1908, end=1917, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: Gentle eminences , with various rounded or flat tops , covered with bright verdure , formed the back-ground ; before them , tall poplar groves , and willow thickets on the bank of the river , whose dark blue waters , splendidly illumined by the setting sun , flowed , with many windings , through the prairie .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=1976, end=1983, entitycategory=LAND_COVER), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=1969, end=1975, sentimentcategory=4), begin=1976, end=1983, linktype=sentiment_of)

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=2363, end=2366, entitycategory=WEATHER), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=2341, end=2362, sentimentcategory=4), begin=2363, end=2366, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: A little further on lay Fort Union , on a verdant plain , with the handsome American flag , gilded by the last rays of evening , floating in the azure sky , while a herd of horses grazing animated the peaceful scene . [ 351 ] As the steamer approached , the cannon of Fort Union fired a salute , with a running fire of musketry , to bid us welcome , which was answered in a similar manner by our vessel .

_sentence_text: The town of Stanton is now on the site of the third village , Awachawi -- ED . [ 336 ] See p. 361 , for illustration of a Blackfoot musical instrument. -- ED . [ 337 ] This fort of Pilcher , built for the Missouri Fur Company about 1822 , was about eleven miles above the mouth of Knife River , and named Fort Vanderburgh .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=5504, end=5513, entitycategory=FAUNA), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=5523, end=5557, sentimentcategory=4), begin=5504, end=5513, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: See _Original Journals of the Lewis and Clark Expedition_ , i , p . 291. -- ED . [ 341 ] See description of bear-dance , with illustration , in Catlin , _North American Indians_ , i , pp . 242-245. -- ED . [ 342 ] These stones are generally granite , not sharp , but rounded in front ; are used by the Indians to break the large bones of the buffaloes , of the marrow of which they are very fond .

_sentence_text: Stones closely resembling these are found among the Blackfoot Indians. -- MAXIMILIAN . [ 343 ] See p. 361 , for illustration of a stone battle-axe. -- ED . [ 344 ] The Little Missouri is the most important North Dakota affluent of the Missouri , above the Cannonball .

_sentence_text: It enters the Missouri in Buford County , having the town of Williston at its mouth. -- ED . [ 351 ] Fort Union was the most important post of the American Fur Company on the upper Missouri .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=9546, end=9554, entitycategory=PERSON), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=9599, end=9620, sentimentcategory=4), begin=9546, end=9554, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: Hamilton was at this time about fifty years of age , punctilious in manner , particular in dress , and both respected and feared by his subordinates .

_sentence_text: Hamilton was at this time about fifty years of age , punctilious in manner , particular in dress , and both respected and feared by his subordinates .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=12040, end=12045, entitycategory=HUM_LANDFORM), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=12097, end=12124, sentimentcategory=4), begin=12040, end=12045, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: Opposite the entrance , on the other side of the quadrangle , is the house of the commandant ; it is one story high , and has four handsome glass windows on each side of the door .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=12216, end=12221, entitycategory=HUM_LANDFORM), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=12230, end=12240, sentimentcategory=4), begin=12216, end=12221, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: This house is very commodious , and , like all the buildings of the inner quadrangle , constructed of poplar wood , the staple wood for building in this neighbourhood .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=12784, end=12790, entitycategory=PERSON), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=12773, end=12783, sentimentcategory=2), begin=12784, end=12790, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: In the inner quadrangle are the residences of the clerks , the interpreters , and the _engagés_ , the powder magazine , the stores , or supplies of goods and bartered skins , various workshops for the handicraftsmen , smiths , carpenters , & c. , stables for the horses and cattle , rooms for receiving and entertaining the Indians ; and in the centre is the flag-staff , around which several half-breed Indian hunters had erected their leathern tents .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=13088, end=13094, entitycategory=FAUNA), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=13099, end=13108, sentimentcategory=4), begin=13088, end=13094, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: The cattle are very fine , and the cows yield abundance of milk .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=13119, end=13123, entitycategory=FAUNA), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=13124, end=13147, sentimentcategory=4), begin=13119, end=13123, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: The cattle are very fine , and the cows yield abundance of milk .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=13154, end=13160, entitycategory=FAUNA), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=13211, end=13232, sentimentcategory=4), begin=13154, end=13160, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: The horses are driven , in the day-time , into the prairie , guarded and exercised by armed men , and , in the evening , brought back into the quadrangle of the fort , where the greater part of them pass the night in the open air .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=14845, end=14854, entitycategory=PERSON), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=15120, end=15154, sentimentcategory=2), begin=14845, end=14854, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: The lower class of these agents , who are called _engagés_ , or _voyageurs_ , have to act as steersmen , rowers , hunters , traders , & c. , according to their several capabilities .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=15061, end=15068, entitycategory=PERSON), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=15104, end=15113, sentimentcategory=2), begin=15061, end=15068, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: They are often sent great distances , employed in perilous undertakings among the Indians , and are obliged to fight against the enemy , and many of them are killed every year by the arms with which the Whites themselves have furnished the Indians .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=15580, end=15587, entitycategory=FAUNA), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=15606, end=15631, sentimentcategory=4), begin=15580, end=15587, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: Wild beasts and other animals , whose skins are valuable in the fur trade , have already diminished greatly in number along this river , and it is said that , in another ten years , the fur trade will be very inconsiderable .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=16689, end=16696, entitycategory=ORGANISATION), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=16739, end=16751, sentimentcategory=4), begin=16689, end=16696, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: Many of these , when not employed in hunting , live at the Company 's forts .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=16689, end=16696, entitycategory=ORGANISATION), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=16754, end=16764, sentimentcategory=4), begin=16689, end=16696, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: Many of these , when not employed in hunting , live at the Company 's forts .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=16689, end=16696, entitycategory=ORGANISATION), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=16767, end=16783, sentimentcategory=4), begin=16689, end=16696, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: Many of these , when not employed in hunting , live at the Company 's forts .

_sentence_text: Many of these , when not employed in hunting , live at the Company 's forts .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=16893, end=16900, entitycategory=ORGANISATION), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=16970, end=16976, sentimentcategory=4), begin=16893, end=16900, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: During the summer , the Company send out , under the direction of an experienced clerk , a number of strong , well-armed , mounted men , who convey the necessary goods and supplies , on pack-horses , to the trading stations , at a distance from the river ; they always observe and enforce the required conditions of the Indians , and not unfrequently come to blows with them .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=16893, end=16900, entitycategory=ORGANISATION), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=16979, end=16989), begin=16893, end=16900, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: During the summer , the Company send out , under the direction of an experienced clerk , a number of strong , well-armed , mounted men , who convey the necessary goods and supplies , on pack-horses , to the trading stations , at a distance from the river ; they always observe and enforce the required conditions of the Indians , and not unfrequently come to blows with them .

_sentence_text: During the summer , the Company send out , under the direction of an experienced clerk , a number of strong , well-armed , mounted men , who convey the necessary goods and supplies , on pack-horses , to the trading stations , at a distance from the river ; they always observe and enforce the required conditions of the Indians , and not unfrequently come to blows with them .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=17535, end=17547, entitycategory=HUM_LANDFORM), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=17595, end=17612, sentimentcategory=2), begin=17535, end=17547, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: Besides the forts which I have so often named , the Company has also small winter posts , called log-houses , or block-houses , among the Indians , quickly erected , and as quickly abandoned : to these the Indians bring their furs , which are purchased , and sent , in the spring , to the trading posts .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=19130, end=19142, entitycategory=FAUNA), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=19164, end=19210, sentimentcategory=4), begin=19130, end=19142, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: Silver foxes : twenty to thirty .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=19862, end=19879, entitycategory=FAUNA), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=19957, end=19976, sentimentcategory=2), begin=19862, end=19879, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: The elk ( _Cervus Canadensis_ , or _major_ ) , is not properly comprehended in the trade , as its skin is too thick and heavy , and is , therefore , used for home consumption .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=20120, end=20125, entitycategory=FAUNA), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=20129, end=20138, sentimentcategory=2), begin=20120, end=20125, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: The buffalo skin is taken , as before observed , from the cows only , as the leather of the bulls is too heavy .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=20145, end=20149, entitycategory=FAUNA), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=20160, end=20177, sentimentcategory=2), begin=20145, end=20149, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: The wolf skins are not at all sought by the company , that is to say , they do not send out any hunters to procure them ; but , if the Indians bring any , they are bought not to create any dissatisfaction , and then they are sold at about a dollar a-piece .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=20403, end=20410, entitycategory=PERSON), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=20439, end=20455, sentimentcategory=2), begin=20403, end=20410, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: The Indians , however , have frequently nothing to offer for barter but their dresses , and painted buffalo robes .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=20952, end=20956, entitycategory=FAUNA), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=20960, end=20969, sentimentcategory=4), begin=20952, end=20956, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: The flesh of the cows is very good , especially the tongues , which are smoked in great numbers , and then sent down to St.

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=21198, end=21204, entitycategory=FAUNA), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=21245, end=21258, sentimentcategory=4), begin=21198, end=21204, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: The consumption of [ pg . 191 ] this animal is immense in North America , and is as indispensable to the Indians as the reindeer is to the Laplanders , and the seal to the Esquimaux .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=21416, end=21422, entitycategory=FAUNA), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=21434, end=21477, sentimentcategory=2), begin=21416, end=21422, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: It is difficult to obtain an exact estimate of the consumption of this animal , which is yearly decreasing and driven further inland .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=21893, end=21899, entitycategory=PERSON), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=21915, end=21979, sentimentcategory=2), begin=21893, end=21899, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: The numerous Indian tribes subsist almost entirely on these animals , sell their skins after retaining a sufficient supply for their clothing , tents , & c. , and the agents of the Company recklessly shoot down these noble animals for their own pleasure , often not making the least use of them , except taking out the tongue .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=22957, end=22967, entitycategory=FLORA), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=22968, end=22981, sentimentcategory=2), begin=22957, end=22967, linktype=sentiment_of)

_sentence_text: Mc Kenzie ascribes to the long-continued drought and high winds .

_sentence_text: The neighbourhood around Fort Union is , as I have observed , a wide , extended prairie , intersected , in a northerly direction , by a chain of rather high , round , clay-slate , and sand-stone hills , from the summits of which we had a wide-spreading view over the country on the other side of the Missouri , and of its junction with the Yellow Stone , of which Mr.

_sentence_text: In all these prairies of North America , as well as in the plains of northern Europe , those remarkable blocks or fragments of red granite , are everywhere scattered , which have afforded the geologist subject for many hypotheses .

_sentence_text: The hills were partly bare , and very few flowers were in blossom ; the whole country was covered with short , dry grass , among which there were numerous round spots with tufts of _Cactus ferox_ , which was only partly in flower .

_sentence_text: Die Ziegenheerden , im oberen Bosna-Thal sehr zahlreich und schön gehalten , vermin¬ dern sich zusehends von hier ab .
