_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=150, end=156, entitycategory=WEATHER), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=137, end=141, sentimentcategory=3), begin=150, end=156, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text:
Author: William Dean Howells
Title: William Dean Howells
Language: English
It was a heaven of better than absolute blue , for there were soft , white clouds in it , and the air that our Sunday breathed under it was , at the beginning of April , as bland as that of an American May-end .

_sentence_text: The orchard trees were in bloom - peach and plum , cherry and pear - whenever you chose to look at them , and all nature seemed to rejoice in the cessation of the two days ' strike which had now enabled us to drive to the station instead of walking and carrying our bags and bundles .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=1278, end=1281, entitycategory=HUM_LANDFORM), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=1269, end=1277, sentimentcategory=2), begin=1278, end=1281, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: Now and then we passed a wretched hut which seemed to be the dwelling of the shepherds we saw tending the flocks , and here and there we came upon a group of farm buildings , all of straw , whether for man or beast , set within a sort of squalid court , with a frowzy suggestion of old women and children about the doors of the cottages .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=1490, end=1495, entitycategory=HUM_LANDFORM), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=1482, end=1489, sentimentcategory=2), begin=1490, end=1495, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: Now and then we passed a wretched hut which seemed to be the dwelling of the shepherds we saw tending the flocks , and here and there we came upon a group of farm buildings , all of straw , whether for man or beast , set within a sort of squalid court , with a frowzy suggestion of old women and children about the doors of the cottages .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=1717, end=1720, entitycategory=NAT_LANDFORM), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=1743, end=1747, sentimentcategory=3), begin=1717, end=1720, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: As we drew near Civita Vecchia the sea widened on our view , wild with a wind that seemed to have been blowing ever since the stormy evening in 1865 when , after looking at the tossing ships in the harbor , we decided to take the diligence for Leghorn , rather than the little steamer we had meant to take .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=2032, end=2046, entitycategory=LOCATION), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=2073, end=2088, sentimentcategory=4), begin=2032, end=2046, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: From our pleasant train we now patronized Civita Vecchia with a recognition of its picturesqueness , unvexed by the choice that then insisted on itself , though the harbor was as full of shipping as of old .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=2381, end=2387, sentimentcategory=2), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=2388, end=2397, entitycategory=HUM_LANDFORM), begin=2381, end=2387, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: There was time to run out for a cup of coffee at the station buffet , where there had been neither station nor buffet in our young time : but doubtless then as now there had been the lonely graveyard outside the town , with its sea-beaten , seaward wall .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=2741, end=2747, entitycategory=BIOME), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=2732, end=2740, sentimentcategory=2), begin=2741, end=2747, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: There were stretches of hopeless morass , with wide acreages under water , but mostly , I should say , it was rather a hilly country .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=3245, end=3254, entitycategory=HUM_LANDFORM), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=3255, end=3269, sentimentcategory=4), begin=3245, end=3254, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: There were many new buildings of a good sort , and of wood as well as stone ; when we came to Grosetto , where we had spent a memorable night after being overturned in the Ombrone , in the attempt of our diligence to pass its flood , we were aware , in the evening light , of a prosperity which , if not excessive for the twoscore years that had passed , was still very noticeable .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=3640, end=3650, entitycategory=HUM_LANDFORM), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=3714, end=3718, sentimentcategory=4), begin=3640, end=3650, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: I should not quite say that the brick wall of the city had been scraped and scrubbed , but it looked very neat and new , and there was a pleasant suburb under it where the moat might have been , and people were coming and going who had almost the effect of commuters ; at least , they seemed to have come out to their homes by trolley .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=3640, end=3650, entitycategory=HUM_LANDFORM), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=3723, end=3726, entitycategory=HUM_LANDFORM, sentimentcategory=4), begin=3640, end=3650, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: I should not quite say that the brick wall of the city had been scraped and scrubbed , but it looked very neat and new , and there was a pleasant suburb under it where the moat might have been , and people were coming and going who had almost the effect of commuters ; at least , they seemed to have come out to their homes by trolley .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=4261, end=4267, entitycategory=NAT_LANDFORM), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=4255, end=4260, sentimentcategory=2), begin=4261, end=4267, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: We resisted an impulse to dismount and go up to the inn in the heart of the town where we had spent that `` night of memory and of sighs . '' But we searched the horizon round for the point on the highway where our diligence had failed of the track between the telegraph-poles and softly rolled with us in the muddy waters , like an elephant taking a bath , but , so far from finding it , we could not even find the highway .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=5330, end=5336, entitycategory=HUM_LANDFORM), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=5323, end=5329, sentimentcategory=2), begin=5330, end=5336, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: The streets and houses were mostly dark , as houses of good habits should be at that hour , but , after passing through a wide , lonely piazza , we struck into a street longer and straighter than the others , and drew up at our hotel door opposite an hilarious cafe , where there seemed a general rejoicing of some sort .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=5455, end=5459, entitycategory=HUM_LANDFORM), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=5445, end=5454, sentimentcategory=4), begin=5455, end=5459, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: The streets and houses were mostly dark , as houses of good habits should be at that hour , but , after passing through a wide , lonely piazza , we struck into a street longer and straighter than the others , and drew up at our hotel door opposite an hilarious cafe , where there seemed a general rejoicing of some sort .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=5455, end=5459, entitycategory=HUM_LANDFORM), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=5483, end=5500, sentimentcategory=4), begin=5455, end=5459, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: The streets and houses were mostly dark , as houses of good habits should be at that hour , but , after passing through a wide , lonely piazza , we struck into a street longer and straighter than the others , and drew up at our hotel door opposite an hilarious cafe , where there seemed a general rejoicing of some sort .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=5789, end=5797, entitycategory=PERSON), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=5784, end=5788, sentimentcategory=4), begin=5789, end=5797, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: In Leghorn the good Baedeker says that all the hotels are good , and this sweeping verdict may be true if taken in the sense that one is as good as another , but they are of the old Italian type which our winter in Rome had taught us to think obsolete ; now we found that it was only obsolescent .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=5816, end=5822, entitycategory=HUM_LANDFORM), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=5827, end=5831, sentimentcategory=4), begin=5816, end=5822, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: In Leghorn the good Baedeker says that all the hotels are good , and this sweeping verdict may be true if taken in the sense that one is as good as another , but they are of the old Italian type which our winter in Rome had taught us to think obsolete ; now we found that it was only obsolescent .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=7893, end=7897, entitycategory=HUM_LANDFORM), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=7871, end=7885, sentimentcategory=4), begin=7893, end=7897, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: We rebuilt our fire , after many repeated demands for kindling , which had apparently to be sawed and split in a distant wood-yard before we could get it , and then the long , arctic night set in , unrelieved by the noisy gayeties of the cafe across the way .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=8867, end=8871, entitycategory=WEATHER), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=8857, end=8866, sentimentcategory=2), begin=8867, end=8871, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: It was wonderful how little way the electric bulb shed its beams in that naughty air ; it would not even light the page which at one time was opened in the vain hope that the author would help the benumbing cold to bring torpor if not slumber to the weary brain .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=9962, end=9966, entitycategory=WEATHER), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=9957, end=9961, sentimentcategory=2), begin=9962, end=9966, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: There was not only steam-heat in the public rooms of the ground floor , but there was furnace heat in all the corridors , and there were fireplaces in certain chambers , which also looked out on the sea , to Corsica and Elba and other isles of it , and would be full of sun as soon as the cold rain closed a fortnight 's activity .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=NULL, begin=10940, end=10948, entitycategory=PERSON, sentimentcategory=2), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=10972, end=11001, sentimentcategory=4), begin=10940, end=10948, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: Our daily return for what we got was a poor twelve francs each ; but fancy a haughty American landlord caressing us with such sweet and reassuring civility for any sum of money !

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=11435, end=11440, entitycategory=HUM_LANDFORM), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=11449, end=11473, sentimentcategory=4), begin=11435, end=11440, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: The place had the true out-of-season charm .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=11499, end=11511, entitycategory=HUM_LANDFORM), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=11491, end=11498, sentimentcategory=4), begin=11499, end=11511, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: There were two stately dining-rooms besides the one where we dined , and there were pleasant spaces where we had afternoon tea or after-dinner coffee , and from which a magnificent stairway ascended to the upper halls , and a quiet lift waited our orders , with the landlord or his son to take us up ; and so lonely and quiet and gentle , with porters and chambermaids speaking beautiful Tuscan , and watchful attendants everywhere prophesying and fulfilling our wants .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=12238, end=12243, entitycategory=FLORA), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=12228, end=12237, sentimentcategory=4), begin=12238, end=12243, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: Outside , the environment flattered or rewarded us with a garden of laurel and other evergreens , and with flower-beds where the annuals were beginning to show the gardener 's designs in their sprouting seeds .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=12265, end=12270, entitycategory=HUM_LANDFORM), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=12259, end=12264, sentimentcategory=2), begin=12265, end=12270, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: Beyond these ample villa bounds a tram-car murmured to and from the well-removed city , and beyond its track lay a line of open-air theatres and variety shows and bathing establishments , as at our own Atlantic City , but here in enduring masonry instead of the provisional wood of our summer architecture .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=12962, end=12967, entitycategory=HUM_LANDFORM), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=13002, end=13016, sentimentcategory=4), begin=12962, end=12967, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: The preparation includes a delightful drive by the seashore , with groves and gardens , to the city gate and indefinitely beyond it , which we one day followed as far as an old fort , where a little hotel had nestled with every promise of simple comfort .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=13109, end=13130, entitycategory=HUM_LANDFORM), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=13221, end=13242, sentimentcategory=4), begin=13109, end=13130, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: There was a neighboring village of no very exciting interest , and I do not know that the Italian Naval Academy , which we passed on the way , was very exciting , though with its villa grounds it had a pleasing rural effect .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=13270, end=13276, entitycategory=HUM_LANDFORM), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=13282, end=13326, sentimentcategory=2), begin=13270, end=13276, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: Hard by our hotel , in a piazza that seemed to have nothing to do but surround it , was the colossal bust of an Italian admiral , or the like , which had not the impressiveness of a colossal full-length figure , but which rendered the original with the faithful realism of the Genoese Campo Santo sculpture .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=13346, end=13372, entitycategory=HUM_LANDFORM), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=13399, end=13454, sentimentcategory=2), begin=13346, end=13372, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: Hard by our hotel , in a piazza that seemed to have nothing to do but surround it , was the colossal bust of an Italian admiral , or the like , which had not the impressiveness of a colossal full-length figure , but which rendered the original with the faithful realism of the Genoese Campo Santo sculpture .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=13346, end=13372, entitycategory=HUM_LANDFORM), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=13498, end=13514, sentimentcategory=4), begin=13346, end=13372, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: Hard by our hotel , in a piazza that seemed to have nothing to do but surround it , was the colossal bust of an Italian admiral , or the like , which had not the impressiveness of a colossal full-length figure , but which rendered the original with the faithful realism of the Genoese Campo Santo sculpture .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=14272, end=14291, entitycategory=PERSON), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=14454, end=14464, sentimentcategory=3), begin=14272, end=14291, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: The Medicean grand-duke who lords it over them , and who erected this monument in honor of himself for the victories his admirals had gained in sweeping the pirates from the seas , is a very proud presence , and is certainly worthy of the admiration which his bronze requires from the spectator .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=15131, end=15146, entitycategory=HUM_LANDFORM), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=15158, end=15164, sentimentcategory=4), begin=15131, end=15146, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: I was going then to view at close quarters the port of Leghorn , which is famous for its mole and lighthouse and quarantine , the first of their kind in their time .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=15324, end=15360, entitycategory=PERSON), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=15369, end=15374, sentimentcategory=4), begin=15324, end=15360, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: The old port , with the fortifications , was the work of a natural son of Queen Elizabeth 's Earl of Leicester , whose noble origin was so constantly recognized by the Tuscan grand-dukes that he came at last to be accepted as Lord Dudley by the English .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=15983, end=15987, entitycategory=HUM_LANDFORM), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=16004, end=16021, sentimentcategory=4), begin=15983, end=15987, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: Both the old and the new port were a scene of pleasant activity the pleasant afternoon when I visited them , and were full of varied sail as well as many steamers , loading or unloading for or from the Mediterranean ports , east and west , and the Hanseatic cities and the far coasts of Norway .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=16258, end=16265, entitycategory=HUM_LANDFORM), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=16269, end=16277, sentimentcategory=4), begin=16258, end=16265, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: Any seaport is charming and full of romantic interest , but an Italian port has always a prime picturesqueness .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=16258, end=16265, entitycategory=HUM_LANDFORM), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=16282, end=16307, sentimentcategory=4), begin=16258, end=16265, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: Any seaport is charming and full of romantic interest , but an Italian port has always a prime picturesqueness .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=16317, end=16329, entitycategory=HUM_LANDFORM), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=16343, end=16364, sentimentcategory=5), begin=16317, end=16329, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: Any seaport is charming and full of romantic interest , but an Italian port has always a prime picturesqueness .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=16371, end=16378, entitycategory=PERSON), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=16425, end=16440, sentimentcategory=4), begin=16371, end=16378, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: Its sailors are the most ancient mariners , and they look full of history , and capable , each of them , of discovering a continent .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=16626, end=16633, entitycategory=LOCATION), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=16650, end=16661, sentimentcategory=4), begin=16626, end=16633, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: Leghorn is still in her lusty youth , being not much older than our Boston in the prosperity which has not failed her since the Medici divined her importance toward the close of the sixteenth century , and fortified her harbor till she was one of the strongest places on the Mediterranean .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=18039, end=18045, entitycategory=HUM_LANDFORM), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=18027, end=18038, sentimentcategory=2), begin=18039, end=18045, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: Then , in the last years of the thirteenth century , the Florentines , Lucchese , and Genoese devastated the whole territory of Pisa , and left Leghorn only one poor little church .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=20273, end=20283, entitycategory=NAT_PHENOMENON), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=20265, end=20272, sentimentcategory=2), begin=20273, end=20283, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: About seventy-five years later the grippe paid Leghorn a first visit , and not long after a violent earthquake shook down many buildings and killed many women and children ; but the authorities did what they could to secure the city in future by declaring the day a perpetual fast , and forbidding masking and dancing on it .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=22001, end=22010, entitycategory=PERSON), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=22072, end=22095, sentimentcategory=4), begin=22001, end=22010, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: Guerrazzi , once famous as the first of Italian novelists and a man of generous mind and heart , who duly suffered arrest and imprisonment when the grand-duke was restored by the Austrians .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=22552, end=22560, entitycategory=HUM_LANDFORM), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=22561, end=22577, sentimentcategory=2), begin=22552, end=22560, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: He died in 1873 , and is remembered in Leghorn by a monument very ineffective as a whole , but singularly interesting in certain details .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=23136, end=23142, entitycategory=PERSON), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=23112, end=23128, sentimentcategory=4), begin=23136, end=23142, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: Perhaps I have the more willingly suppressed a few war-like facts , in the interest of the superstition I had cherished that Leghorn was without a history , or that it had no more history than , most American cities of equal date with its commercial importance , which began with the wise hospitality of the Medici to merchants of all races and nations , religions and races , settled there , and especially to the Spanish Jews who came in great numbers to the city that it was a common saying that you had as well strike the duke as strike a Jew in Leghorn .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=23663, end=23671, entitycategory=PERSON), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=23766, end=23777, sentimentcategory=4), begin=23663, end=23671, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: These captives not only served as models for the Moors at the base of his monument , but they must have been very useful in the different public works which he and his successors carried out .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=24447, end=24455, entitycategory=HUM_LANDFORM), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=24396, end=24425, sentimentcategory=2), begin=24447, end=24455, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: Generally speaking , I think that they were rather bare in painting or sculpture , but they were such churches as in America one would go a long way to see and think one 's self well rewarded by their objects of interest .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=24972, end=24979, entitycategory=HUM_LANDFORM), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=24963, end=24971, sentimentcategory=4), begin=24972, end=24979, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: But , if I did not much resort to the churches and galleries in Leghorn , I roamed gladly through its pleasant streets and squares , and by the shores of the canals which once gave it the name of New Venice , and which still invite the smaller shipping up among its houses in right Venetian fashion .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=24984, end=24991, entitycategory=HUM_LANDFORM), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=24963, end=24971, sentimentcategory=4), begin=24984, end=24991, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: But , if I did not much resort to the churches and galleries in Leghorn , I roamed gladly through its pleasant streets and squares , and by the shores of the canals which once gave it the name of New Venice , and which still invite the smaller shipping up among its houses in right Venetian fashion .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=25745, end=25751, entitycategory=HUM_LANDFORM), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=25716, end=25727, sentimentcategory=4), begin=25745, end=25751, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: From the force of the mid-April sun in these streets I realized what they might be in summer , and , if I lived in Leghorn , I would rather live on the sea-front , in one of the comfortable , square , stone villas which border it .

_sentence_text:
Author: Hugh Macmillan
Title: Hugh Macmillan
Language: English
Here was situated the entrenchment called the Cluilian Dyke , where Hannibal encamped , and where previously the Roman and Alban armies were drawn up in battle array , when it was agreed that the quarrel between them should be settled by three champions chosen from each side .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=419, end=427, entitycategory=PERSON), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=411, end=418, sentimentcategory=2), begin=419, end=427, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: Every one knows the story of the Horatii and the Curiatii : how these hapless brothers and cousins fought in sight of both armies with a bravery worthy of the stake ; and how , at length , when two of the Roman heroes were slain , and all the Albans were wounded , the third Roman , who was unhurt , feigned to fly , and thus separating his enemies , who followed him as well as their failing strength would permit , easily despatched them one after the other , and thus gained the victory for the Roman cause .

_sentence_text: This terrible tragedy , which terminated the independent existence of the Alban power , took place in the fields around here ; and on the right-hand side of the road are three huge circular mounds , overgrown with long rich grass , planted with tall cypress and ilex trees , and surrounded at the foot with a wall of huge peperino blocks , which antiquarians have determined to be the tombs of the five slaughtered combatants - the farther mound being that of the two Horatii , the second that of one of the Curiatii , and the third that of the other two Curiatii .

_sentence_text: On the opposite side of the road , beyond the earthen mounds of the Horatii and Curiatii , a large mass of picturesque ruins covers the Campagna for a considerable distance .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=2873, end=2878, entitycategory=HUM_LANDFORM), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=2845, end=2872, sentimentcategory=4), begin=2873, end=2878, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: On the opposite side of the road , beyond the earthen mounds of the Horatii and Curiatii , a large mass of picturesque ruins covers the Campagna for a considerable distance .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=2961, end=2970, entitycategory=LOCATION), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=2971, end=2975, entitycategory=LOCATION), begin=2961, end=2970, linktype=refers_to)
_sentence_text: The peasants persist in calling this spot Roma Vecchia , under the idea that ancient Rome stood there , and that these ruins are the remains of the city .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=2971, end=2975, entitycategory=LOCATION), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=2976, end=2983, sentimentcategory=4), begin=2971, end=2975, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: The peasants persist in calling this spot Roma Vecchia , under the idea that ancient Rome stood there , and that these ruins are the remains of the city .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=3164, end=3169, entitycategory=HUM_LANDFORM), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=3149, end=3154, sentimentcategory=4), begin=3164, end=3169, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: Antiquarians , however , are agreed that the ruins belong to the large suburban villa of the Quintilii , one of the noblest and most virtuous families of ancient Rome .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=3281, end=3292, entitycategory=PERSON), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=3270, end=3280, sentimentcategory=4), begin=3281, end=3292, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: One member , the celebrated rhetorician Quintilian , was the first who enjoyed the regular salary allotted by Vespasian to those who provided a solid education for the upper classes .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=4254, end=4259, entitycategory=HUM_LANDFORM), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=4278, end=4287, sentimentcategory=2), begin=4254, end=4259, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: The tyrant then took possession of their villa , which became as notorious for the evil deeds done in it as it was famous before for the virtuous life of its owners .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=4254, end=4259, entitycategory=HUM_LANDFORM), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=4328, end=4334, sentimentcategory=4), begin=4254, end=4259, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: The tyrant then took possession of their villa , which became as notorious for the evil deeds done in it as it was famous before for the virtuous life of its owners .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=4421, end=4427, entitycategory=PERSON), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=4414, end=4420, sentimentcategory=4), begin=4421, end=4427, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: Here Commodus , the base son of a heroic father , practised those lusts and brutalities which have branded his name as that of one of the most unmitigated monsters that ever stained the pages of history .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=5373, end=5380, entitycategory=PERSON), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=5364, end=5372, sentimentcategory=2), begin=5373, end=5380, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: Here , too , the wretched emperor himself was first poisoned by a cup of wine given to him by his favourite mistress Marcia , on his return weary and thirsty from the Colosseum ; and then , as the poison operated too slowly , was strangled in his heavy drugged sleep by his favourite gladiator Narcissus .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=5373, end=5380, entitycategory=PERSON), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=5399, end=5407, sentimentcategory=1), begin=5373, end=5380, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: Here , too , the wretched emperor himself was first poisoned by a cup of wine given to him by his favourite mistress Marcia , on his return weary and thirsty from the Colosseum ; and then , as the poison operated too slowly , was strangled in his heavy drugged sleep by his favourite gladiator Narcissus .

_sentence_text: Here , too , the wretched emperor himself was first poisoned by a cup of wine given to him by his favourite mistress Marcia , on his return weary and thirsty from the Colosseum ; and then , as the poison operated too slowly , was strangled in his heavy drugged sleep by his favourite gladiator Narcissus .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=5631, end=5640, entitycategory=PERSON), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=5621, end=5630, sentimentcategory=4), begin=5631, end=5640, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: Here , too , the wretched emperor himself was first poisoned by a cup of wine given to him by his favourite mistress Marcia , on his return weary and thirsty from the Colosseum ; and then , as the poison operated too slowly , was strangled in his heavy drugged sleep by his favourite gladiator Narcissus .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=5696, end=5701, entitycategory=HUM_LANDFORM), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=5677, end=5692, sentimentcategory=3), begin=5696, end=5701, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: One could not look upon the bare masses of ruins around without thinking of the terrible orgies that took place there , and of the shout of enthusiastic joy when the news reached Rome that the detested tyrant was no more , and the empire was free to breathe again .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=5855, end=5861, entitycategory=PERSON), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=5846, end=5854, sentimentcategory=1), begin=5855, end=5861, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: One could not look upon the bare masses of ruins around without thinking of the terrible orgies that took place there , and of the shout of enthusiastic joy when the news reached Rome that the detested tyrant was no more , and the empire was free to breathe again .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=5884, end=5890, entitycategory=ORGANISATION), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=5891, end=5894, sentimentcategory=5), begin=5884, end=5890, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: One could not look upon the bare masses of ruins around without thinking of the terrible orgies that took place there , and of the shout of enthusiastic joy when the news reached Rome that the detested tyrant was no more , and the empire was free to breathe again .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=6051, end=6059, entitycategory=PERSON), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=6042, end=6050, sentimentcategory=2), begin=6051, end=6059, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: The fate of Ahab , who coveted the vineyard of Naboth , overtook him ; and but for the interference of his successor , the maddened populace would have dragged his corpse through the streets and flung it into the Tiber .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=6161, end=6165, entitycategory=HUM_LANDFORM), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=6142, end=6160, sentimentcategory=5), begin=6161, end=6165, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: A very extraordinary tomb arrests the attention near the ruins of this villa .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=6245, end=6252, entitycategory=HUM_LANDFORM), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=6236, end=6244, sentimentcategory=3), begin=6245, end=6252, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: It looks like an inverted pyramid , or a huge architectural mushroom .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=6279, end=6287, entitycategory=FLORA), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=6260, end=6264, sentimentcategory=4), begin=6279, end=6287, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: It looks like an inverted pyramid , or a huge architectural mushroom .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=6819, end=6827, entitycategory=HUM_LANDFORM), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=6810, end=6818, sentimentcategory=4), begin=6819, end=6827, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: Next to this singular monument are the remains of a tomb which must be exceedingly interesting to every classical scholar .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=6836, end=6853, entitycategory=HUM_LANDFORM), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=6868, end=6891, sentimentcategory=5), begin=6836, end=6853, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: Next to this singular monument are the remains of a tomb which must be exceedingly interesting to every classical scholar .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=7014, end=7017, entitycategory=PERSON), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=7006, end=7013, sentimentcategory=4), begin=7014, end=7017, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: The inscription indicates that it is the tomb of Quintus Cæcilius , whose nephew and adopted son , Titus Pomponius Atticus , as Cornelius Nepos tells us , was buried in it .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=7117, end=7123, entitycategory=PERSON), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=7100, end=7110, sentimentcategory=4), begin=7117, end=7123, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: This celebrated Roman knight was descended in a direct line from Numa Pompilius .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=7541, end=7547, entitycategory=PERSON), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=7526, end=7540, sentimentcategory=4), begin=7541, end=7547, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: At the Greek capital , the then university of the world , he secured the devoted friendship of his fellow-student Cicero , whose brother was afterwards married to his sister ; and to this intimacy we owe the largest portion of Cicero 's unrivalled letters , in which he describes his inmost feelings , as well as the events going on around him .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=7837, end=7841, entitycategory=HUM_LANDFORM), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=7830, end=7836, sentimentcategory=4), begin=7837, end=7841, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: The uncle of Atticus , the brother of his mother , whose family tomb we are now examining , left him at his death an enormous fortune , which he had amassed by usury .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=8066, end=8072, entitycategory=PERSON), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=8057, end=8065, sentimentcategory=2), begin=8066, end=8072, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: Atticus added greatly to it by acting as a kind of publisher to the authors of the day - that is , by employing his numerous slaves in copying and multiplying their manuscripts .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=8871, end=8875, entitycategory=PERSON), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=8840, end=8845, sentimentcategory=4), begin=8871, end=8875, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: In all likelihood Terentia herself , Cicero 's brave and devoted but ill-used wife , was interred here with her own friends , for her husband had divorced her in order to marry a beautiful and rich young heiress , whose guardian he had been .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=8871, end=8875, entitycategory=PERSON), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=8850, end=8857, sentimentcategory=4), begin=8871, end=8875, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: In all likelihood Terentia herself , Cicero 's brave and devoted but ill-used wife , was interred here with her own friends , for her husband had divorced her in order to marry a beautiful and rich young heiress , whose guardian he had been .

_sentence_text: In all likelihood Terentia herself , Cicero 's brave and devoted but ill-used wife , was interred here with her own friends , for her husband had divorced her in order to marry a beautiful and rich young heiress , whose guardian he had been .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=8997, end=9004, entitycategory=PERSON), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=8972, end=8981, sentimentcategory=4), begin=8997, end=9004, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: In all likelihood Terentia herself , Cicero 's brave and devoted but ill-used wife , was interred here with her own friends , for her husband had divorced her in order to marry a beautiful and rich young heiress , whose guardian he had been .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=8997, end=9004, entitycategory=PERSON), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=8986, end=8990, sentimentcategory=4), begin=8997, end=9004, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: In all likelihood Terentia herself , Cicero 's brave and devoted but ill-used wife , was interred here with her own friends , for her husband had divorced her in order to marry a beautiful and rich young heiress , whose guardian he had been .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=8997, end=9004, entitycategory=PERSON), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=8991, end=8996, sentimentcategory=4), begin=8997, end=9004, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: In all likelihood Terentia herself , Cicero 's brave and devoted but ill-used wife , was interred here with her own friends , for her husband had divorced her in order to marry a beautiful and rich young heiress , whose guardian he had been .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=9216, end=9225, entitycategory=HUM_LANDFORM), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=9186, end=9204, sentimentcategory=5), begin=9216, end=9225, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: Passing on the same side of the road two or three tombs of obscure persons whose names alone are known , we come at the sixth milestone to one of the most extraordinary sepulchral monuments of the Appian Way , called the Casale Rotondo .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=9355, end=9357, entitycategory=HUM_LANDFORM), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=9417, end=9441, sentimentcategory=4), begin=9355, end=9357, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: It is circular , like the tomb of Cæcilia Metella ; but it is of far larger dimensions , being nearly three hundred and fifty feet in diameter .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=9539, end=9543, entitycategory=HUM_LANDFORM), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=9530, end=9538, sentimentcategory=4), begin=9539, end=9543, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: In the fifteenth century this colossal ruin was converted into a fortress by the Orsini family ; and of the remains of this fortification a farmhouse and other buildings were constructed , and these now stand on the summit , surrounded by a tolerably-sized oliveyard and garden , with a sloping grass-grown stair leading up to them on the outside .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=9757, end=9766, entitycategory=HUM_LANDFORM), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=9741, end=9756, sentimentcategory=3), begin=9757, end=9766, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: In the fifteenth century this colossal ruin was converted into a fortress by the Orsini family ; and of the remains of this fortification a farmhouse and other buildings were constructed , and these now stand on the summit , surrounded by a tolerably-sized oliveyard and garden , with a sloping grass-grown stair leading up to them on the outside .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=9971, end=9980, entitycategory=LOCATION), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=9945, end=9963, sentimentcategory=4), begin=9971, end=9980, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: Notwithstanding their dislike of death and their horror of dead bodies , the modern Romans have no more repugnance to the proximity of tombs than their ancestors had .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=10081, end=10086, entitycategory=HUM_LANDFORM), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=10077, end=10080, sentimentcategory=3), begin=10081, end=10086, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: Shepherds fold their sheep and goats in the interior of the old tombs , whose walls are blackened with the smoke of the fires , and retain an odour of human and animal occupancy more disagreeable than any which the original tenants could have exhaled ; and it is by no means unfrequent to find a wine-shop , with a noisy company of wayfarers regaling themselves , in a sepulchre that happens to be conveniently situated by the wayside .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=10241, end=10248, entitycategory=PERSON), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=10232, end=10240, sentimentcategory=4), begin=10241, end=10248, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: Shepherds fold their sheep and goats in the interior of the old tombs , whose walls are blackened with the smoke of the fires , and retain an odour of human and animal occupancy more disagreeable than any which the original tenants could have exhaled ; and it is by no means unfrequent to find a wine-shop , with a noisy company of wayfarers regaling themselves , in a sepulchre that happens to be conveniently situated by the wayside .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=10579, end=10584, entitycategory=HUM_LANDFORM), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=10561, end=10569, sentimentcategory=4), begin=10579, end=10584, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: So far as can be ascertained , the original appearance of the Casale Rotondo seems to have been that of an enormous circular tower , cased with large blocks of travertine , covered with a pyramidal roof of the same material carved into the semblance of tiles , and surmounted with appropriate sculpture .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=10921, end=10930, entitycategory=PERSON), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=10915, end=10920, sentimentcategory=3), begin=10921, end=10930, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: It was surrounded with a wall of peperino , supporting at intervals vases and statues ; and on the outside were semicircular stone seats for the benefit of weary wayfarers .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=11084, end=11089, entitycategory=FLORA), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=11078, end=11083, sentimentcategory=3), begin=11084, end=11089, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: This wall is now grown over with turf , but it can be distinctly traced all round ; and the hollow space between it and the tomb is covered with thick grass , and is sometimes filled with water like a fosse .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=11151, end=11157, entitycategory=HUM_LANDFORM), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=11142, end=11150, sentimentcategory=4), begin=11151, end=11157, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: Numerous altars , pedestals , and fine specimens of sculpture in marble and peperino , have been disinterred in this spot , and they are now arranged to advantage at the foot of the huge pile fronting the road .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=11520, end=11529, entitycategory=PERSON), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=11506, end=11519, sentimentcategory=4), begin=11520, end=11529, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: Some of these bear inscriptions which would indicate that the tomb was erected to Messalla Corvinus , the friend of Horace and Augustus , and himself a distinguished historian and poet as well as one of the most influential senators of Rome , by his son Marcus Aurelius Corvinus Cotta , who was consul some years after his father 's death .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=11534, end=11538, entitycategory=PERSON), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=11506, end=11519, sentimentcategory=4), begin=11534, end=11538, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: Some of these bear inscriptions which would indicate that the tomb was erected to Messalla Corvinus , the friend of Horace and Augustus , and himself a distinguished historian and poet as well as one of the most influential senators of Rome , by his son Marcus Aurelius Corvinus Cotta , who was consul some years after his father 's death .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=11578, end=11586, entitycategory=PERSON), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=11561, end=11577, sentimentcategory=4), begin=11578, end=11586, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: Some of these bear inscriptions which would indicate that the tomb was erected to Messalla Corvinus , the friend of Horace and Augustus , and himself a distinguished historian and poet as well as one of the most influential senators of Rome , by his son Marcus Aurelius Corvinus Cotta , who was consul some years after his father 's death .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=11755, end=11759, entitycategory=HUM_LANDFORM), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=11890, end=11894, sentimentcategory=4), begin=11755, end=11759, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: Corvinus died in the eleventh year of our era , so that the tomb has stood for upwards of eighteen centuries and a half ; and it is as likely to stand as many more , for what remains of it is as firm and enduring as a rock .

_sentence_text: I did not see the tenants of this curious dwelling during my visit ; but if the skeleton at the Egyptian feast was a useful reminder of human mortality to the revellers , one would suppose that the thought of the peculiar character of their home would be sufficient to impart a soberer hue to their lives .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=12757, end=12764, entitycategory=HUM_LANDFORM), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=12751, end=12756, sentimentcategory=3), begin=12757, end=12764, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: What is our earth itself but , on a vaster scale , a Casale Rotondo - a garden in a sepulchre - where the dust we tread on was once alive ; and we reap our daily bread from human mould - `` Earth builds on the earth castles and towers , Earth says to the earth - All shall be ours . '' At a distance of about seven minutes ' walk is an enormous circular tomb , with a medieval tower of lava stones erected upon it , called the Torre di Selce ; but there is nothing to indicate who was interred in it , though it must have been a person of some celebrity at the time .

_sentence_text: The road after this descends into a valley , through which the stream of the Ponticello flows , passing a most massive circular tomb , reminding one of the mounds of the Horatii and Curiatii ; and as it ascends gradually on the opposite side , two huge sepulchres of the Imperial period - one on the right hand and the other on the left - attract notice , and are the last on this part of the route .

_sentence_text: One feels , when gazing on the long perspective of rugged and mouldering sepulchres , the full force of the name Strada del Diavolo which the peasants give to this street of tombs ; and can sympathise with the sentiment that made Charles Dickens say , when standing here at sunset , after having walked all the way from Rome , `` I almost felt as if the sun would never rise again , but look its last that night upon a ruined world . '' We can picture St.

_sentence_text: The thought that the eye of the great apostle must have rested upon the same features of the landscape , and many of the same objects , though now in ruins , that we still behold , invests them with an indescribable charm .

_sentence_text: From beyond the gates of Albano , near which stood the lofty tomb of Pompey , whose ashes had only recently been brought from the scene of his murder in Egypt , by his devoted wife Cornelia , he would obtain his first glimpse of Rome .

_sentence_text: Doubtless with a sad and pitying heart , he would be led by the cohort of soldiers along the street of tombs , then the most crowded approach to a city of nearly two millions of souls ; tombs whose massiveness and solidity were but a vain craving for immortality , and whose epitaphs were the most deeply touching of all epitaphs , on account of the profound despair with which they bade their eternal farewell .

_sentence_text: Entering into Rome through the Porta Capena ; and winding through the valley between the Coelian and Aventine hills , crowded with temples and palaces , he would be brought to the Forum , then a scene of indescribable grandeur ; and from thence he would be finally transferred to the charge of Burrus , the prefect of the imperial guards , at the prætorium of Nero 's palace , on the Palatine .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=20044, end=20049, entitycategory=HUM_LANDFORM), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=20030, end=20037, sentimentcategory=4), begin=20044, end=20049, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: We only know of a certainty that for two whole years `` he dwelt in his own hired house , and received all that came in unto him , preaching the kingdom of God , and teaching those things concerning the Lord Jesus Christ , with all confidence , no man forbidding him . '' Of all the splendid associations of the Appian Way , along which history may be said to have marched exclusively for nigh six hundred years , the most splendid by far is its connection with this ever-memorable journey of the great Apostle of the Gentiles .

_sentence_text: He had a deeper yearning for the Gentiles , because he thus beheld with his own eyes the places associated with the darkest aspects of paganism ; the scenes that gave rise to the pagan ideas of heaven and hell ; the splendid temples in which the human soul had debased itself to objects beneath the dignity of its own nature , and thus prepared itself for all moral corruption ; and the massive sepulchral monuments in which the hopeless despair of heathenism had , as it were , become petrified by the Gorgon gaze of death .

_sentence_text: That Appian Way should be to us the most interesting of all the roads of the world ; for by it came to us our civilisation and Christianity - the divine principles and hopes that redeem the soul , retrieve the vanity of existence , open up the path of life through the dark valley of death , and disclose the glorious vista of immortality beyond the tomb .

_sentence_text: It was held sacred from time immemorial ; an altar existed there long before Elijah 's discomfiture of the priests of Baal ; the people were accustomed to resort to the sanctuary of its `` high place '' during new moons and Sabbaths ; and to its haunted strand came pilgrims from distant regions , to which the fame of its sanctity had spread .

_sentence_text: One of the great schools of the prophets of Israel , superintended by Elisha , was planted on one of its mountain prominences .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=23210, end=23216, entitycategory=PERSON), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=23201, end=23209, sentimentcategory=3), begin=23210, end=23216, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: The solitary Elijah found a refuge in its bosom , and came and went from it to the haunts of men like one of its own sudden storms ; and in its rocky dells and dense thickets of oaks and evergreens were uttered prophecies of a larger history and a grander salvation , which transcended the narrow circle of Jewish ideas as much as the excellency of Carmel transcended the other landscapes of Palestine .

_sentence_text: And at Cumæ this western tendency of Italy was most pronounced .

_sentence_text: On this westmost promontory of the beautiful land - the farthest point reached by the oldest civilisation of Egypt and Greece - the Sibyl stood on her watch-tower , and gazed with prophetic eye upon the distant horizon , seeing beyond the light of the setting sun and `` the baths of all the western stars '' the dawn of a more wonderful future , and dreamt of a - `` Vast brotherhood of hearts and hands , Choir of a world in perfect tune . '' Cumæ is only five miles distant from Puteoli , and about thirteen west of Naples .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=25996, end=26000, entitycategory=HUM_LANDFORM), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=25985, end=25989, sentimentcategory=4), begin=25996, end=26000, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: There are two ways by which it can be approached , either by the Via Cumana , which gradually ascends from Puteoli along the ridge of the low volcanic hills on the western side of Lake Avernus , and passes under the Arco Felice , a huge brick arch , evidently a fragment of an ancient Roman aqueduct , spanning a ravine at a great height ; or directly from the western shore of Lake Avernus , by an ancient road paved with blocks of lava , and leading through an enormous tunnel , called the Grotta de Pietro Pace , about three-quarters of a mile long , lighted at intervals by shafts from above , said to have been excavated by Agrippa .

_sentence_text: A special evening trip to Park Point to see the spectacular sunset from the highest point in the park is $ 1.50 per person .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=15177, end=15183, entitycategory=PERSON), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=15165, end=15176, sentimentcategory=4), begin=15177, end=15183, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: Longer 1-day trips for experienced riders are available at $ 2 per person more than the rate for the shorter 1-day trips .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=1078, end=1086, entitycategory=PERSON), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=1058, end=1077, sentimentcategory=2), begin=1078, end=1086, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: If so , let us turn to the story of the miner , who , confident that he was the possessor of a valuable claim , held on to it in spite of the most adverse circumstances , hiring himself out in winter that he might have a little money wherewith to work upon his claim in summer , until , at last , after eight years of indomitable perseverance and patient toil , he was able to sell his property for $ 2,250,000 ; or that of the weary and penniless wanderer , who , having tramped all the way from Nevada , began a toilsome search , to be continued through much suffering and privation for several years , but destined to be rewarded at last by the discovery of one of the richest veins of gold in the Territory , a vein that has yielded , up to the present time , $ 4,000,000 worth of gold .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=2916, end=2930, entitycategory=HUM_LANDFORM), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=2942, end=2984, sentimentcategory=4), begin=2916, end=2930, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: Among the many famous mines on the eastern slope of the mountains are the Drum Lumon , shipping $ 80,000 worth of bullion per month , of which fully one-half may be set down as profit ; the Gloster , shipping $ 50,000 worth per month ; the Whitlach Union , long the most celebrated gold mine in the Territory ; those of Red Mountain , said to be the most important undeveloped mineral field in the United States ; the Clark 's Fork , bordering on the National Park , and now yielding , and with no railroad facilities , 855 tons of ore per day ; those of the Helena Mining and Reduction Company at Wickes , reached by a branch of the Northern Pacific Railroad from Prickly Pear Junction , and known to have shipped as much as $ 125,000 worth of ore in a single month ; and the Lexington , which has produced silver ore averaging in assay value from $ 15,000 to $ 20,000 per ton .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=2996, end=3008, entitycategory=HUM_LANDFORM), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=3026, end=3087, sentimentcategory=4), begin=2996, end=3008, linktype=sentiment_of)

_sentence_text: It is at the head of this valley , on the western slope of the main range of the Rocky Mountains , and fifteen miles from the Pipestone Pass , that there has been witnessed , during the last three or four years , that rapid growth of population and wealth that is without parallel , even in the marvelous annals of mining .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=7448, end=7457, entitycategory=NAT_LANDFORM), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=7432, end=7444, sentimentcategory=4), begin=7448, end=7457, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: Here , encompassed on three sides by lofty ranges of mountains , Butte pours forth the smoke of its innumerable furnaces ; for not only is its production of silver so great that it has come to be designated the `` Silver City , '' but its copper mines are such as to give employment to the most extensive smelting works in the United States .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=7634, end=7646, entitycategory=HUM_LANDFORM), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=7662, end=7735, sentimentcategory=4), begin=7634, end=7646, linktype=sentiment_of)

_sentence_text: The leading silver mines of the district are the Alice , Moulton , Lexington and Silver Bow , which alone employ 210 stamps and produce 230 tons of ore daily .

_sentence_text: The magnificent appliances of the Alice mine , including the great Cornish pump that cost $ 40,000 , are the wonder of every visitor .

_sentence_text: It claims to be the most complete mine in the entire West , and it is certainly one of the richest and most extensive .

_sentence_text: At the head of the rich and powerful companies engaged in this industry , stands the Anaconda , -- its mine at Butte , the greatest copper property in America ; its smelting works , at the neighboring town of Anaconda , the largest of their kind in the world .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=10622, end=10637, entitycategory=ORGANISATION), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=10576, end=10612, sentimentcategory=4), begin=10622, end=10637, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: Second only to this gigantic concern , is the Parrott Company , whose total matte output for 1884 was 14,856,323 pounds , containing 9,324,805 pounds of pure copper , valued , including its silver contents , at about $ 1,250,000 .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=11007, end=11014, entitycategory=ORGANISATION), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=11017, end=11114, sentimentcategory=4), begin=11007, end=11014, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: Among other leading companies , may be mentioned the Montana , owning some of the richest and most steadily productive mining property in process of development ; Clark 's Colusa , said to have in sight , above the 300-foot level , at least 150,000 tons of valuable ore ; and the Bell and Colorado , two of the richest copper-silver mines in the district .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=11438, end=11442, entitycategory=HUM_LANDFORM), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=11470, end=11511, sentimentcategory=3), begin=11438, end=11442, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: Briefly , it may be said to be a typical Western town , as seen in flush times ; nothing too big for it , nothing too good ; its quivering energy finding expression , now in the erection of a $ 150,000 court house , and now in that of the finest opera house on the Pacific slope , outside of San Francisco ; its business enterprise filling magnificent stores with costly goods , suited to the tastes , pocket-books and spending proclivities of a community that on last Christmas eve spent $ 6,000 in presents in a single one of its stores . [ Illustration : FALLS OF THE GIBBON RIVER , YELLOWSTONE NATIONAL PARK . ] There are several good trout streams in the vicinity of Butte , and it is pleasant to know that , in a city whose amusements are mainly of a very different character , there are those who know how to handle the rod .

_sentence_text: Briefly , it may be said to be a typical Western town , as seen in flush times ; nothing too big for it , nothing too good ; its quivering energy finding expression , now in the erection of a $ 150,000 court house , and now in that of the finest opera house on the Pacific slope , outside of San Francisco ; its business enterprise filling magnificent stores with costly goods , suited to the tastes , pocket-books and spending proclivities of a community that on last Christmas eve spent $ 6,000 in presents in a single one of its stores . [ Illustration : FALLS OF THE GIBBON RIVER , YELLOWSTONE NATIONAL PARK . ] There are several good trout streams in the vicinity of Butte , and it is pleasant to know that , in a city whose amusements are mainly of a very different character , there are those who know how to handle the rod .

_sentence_text: Even in the vicinity of Missoula there is excellent sport , one local trapper obtaining $ 160 bounty for bear last season .

_sentence_text: The most interesting , as it is the most accessible , of the Indian reservations contiguous to the line of the Northern Pacific Railroad , is that of the Flathead tribe , through which the line runs for many miles in the course of its north-westward sweep from Missoula .

_sentence_text: For a full account of the excellent work carried on among the Indians by the Jesuit Fathers , together with an exceedingly interesting description of the Flathead country generally , the reader is referred to an article in the _Century Magazine_ for October , 1882 , from the accomplished pen of Mr.

_sentence_text: From a point about 500 feet from the summit of Macdonald 's Peak , a few miles north of Ravalli , there is a remarkable view of a deep mountain gorge known as Pumpelly Cañon , which has many of the striking features of the Yosemite valley , in California .

_sentence_text: This lake falls , by another cataract , into a second lake of exactly the same size and shape as the first , while still another cataract leaps from the lower lake into a deep ravine filled with magnificent forest trees .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=15548, end=15553, entitycategory=HUM_LANDFORM), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=15543, end=15547, sentimentcategory=4), begin=15548, end=15553, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: Saddle horses are obtainable at the mission , and there is a good trail all the way .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=16084, end=16103, entitycategory=HUM_LANDFORM), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=16110, end=16153, sentimentcategory=2), begin=16084, end=16103, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: The distress that followed the arrival in this district , in 1883 , of several thousand half-starving adventurers , who , expecting to pick up in a few hours ' time nuggets enough to make them rich for life , brought neither blankets to protect them from the cold of winter , nor the means of returning to their far-distant homes , or even of reaching less remote centres where work could be obtained , gave the C [ oe ] ur d'Alène mines a blow from which they were slow to recover .

_sentence_text: The matchless river scenery that has done so much toward placing the Northern Pacific Railroad system in the proud position it occupies to-day at the head of the scenic railways of America , is not alone that of the peerless Columbia .

_sentence_text: Should the traveler wake up in the morning , anywhere between the point at which the waters of the Missoula empty themselves into the bright green flood of the Pend d'Oreille river and the head of Pend d'Oreille Lake , he will almost certainly suppose that it is in the current of the far-famed Columbia that he sees reflected , perhaps hundreds of feet beneath him , the varying forms of those stately mountains that soar thousands of feet above .
