_sentence_text: So evenly distributed are the beauties of this long stretch of river scenery , that it is not easy to single out particular points as calling for special notice .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=18759, end=18764, entitycategory=NAT_LANDFORM), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=19082, end=19111, sentimentcategory=4), begin=18759, end=18764, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: The first , one mile east of Cabinet , where the river , which has been flowing for some distance considerably below the level of the railroad , enters a magnificent rocky gorge ; and the other , about the same distance east of Clark 's Fork , where it flows , without a ripple , through a forest of stately pines , whose forms are , with singular fidelity , reflected in its clear and tranquil waters .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=18876, end=18887, entitycategory=NAT_LANDFORM), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=18864, end=18875, sentimentcategory=4), begin=18876, end=18887, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: The first , one mile east of Cabinet , where the river , which has been flowing for some distance considerably below the level of the railroad , enters a magnificent rocky gorge ; and the other , about the same distance east of Clark 's Fork , where it flows , without a ripple , through a forest of stately pines , whose forms are , with singular fidelity , reflected in its clear and tranquil waters .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=19018, end=19023, entitycategory=FLORA), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=19010, end=19017, sentimentcategory=4), begin=19018, end=19023, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: The first , one mile east of Cabinet , where the river , which has been flowing for some distance considerably below the level of the railroad , enters a magnificent rocky gorge ; and the other , about the same distance east of Clark 's Fork , where it flows , without a ripple , through a forest of stately pines , whose forms are , with singular fidelity , reflected in its clear and tranquil waters .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=19214, end=19233, entitycategory=NAT_LANDFORM), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=19207, end=19213, sentimentcategory=4), begin=19214, end=19233, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: Soon it is lost to view , but only to reappear , after a short interval , in the form of the lovely LAKE PEND D'OREILLE .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=19291, end=19310, entitycategory=NAT_LANDFORM), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=19311, end=19380, sentimentcategory=4), begin=19291, end=19310, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: One of the largest sheets of fresh water in the West , Lake Pend d'Oreille will certainly yield to none in the beauty and variety of its scenery .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=19482, end=19487, entitycategory=NAT_LANDFORM), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=19517, end=19535, sentimentcategory=4), begin=19482, end=19487, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: Fifty-five miles in extreme length , and from three to twelve miles in width , it has an irregular shore line of probably 250 miles , richly diversified with rock and foliage , and surmounted by lofty ranges of hills .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=19594, end=19599, entitycategory=NAT_LANDFORM), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=19578, end=19583, sentimentcategory=4), begin=19594, end=19599, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: Fifty-five miles in extreme length , and from three to twelve miles in width , it has an irregular shore line of probably 250 miles , richly diversified with rock and foliage , and surmounted by lofty ranges of hills .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=19968, end=19972, entitycategory=HUM_LANDFORM), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=19977, end=20006, sentimentcategory=4), begin=19968, end=19972, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: Such accommodations as have hitherto been available to the visitor have been provided by respectable residents of Sand Point ; but for the season of 1886 arrangements will be made that will constitute Hope the more convenient halting place .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=20211, end=20215, entitycategory=NAT_LANDFORM), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=20218, end=20263, sentimentcategory=5), begin=20211, end=20215, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: While the view from the car windows is not to be compared with the scenery at the southern end of the lake , it must , nevertheless , be pronounced superb .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=20306, end=20312, entitycategory=NAT_LANDFORM), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=20313, end=20329, sentimentcategory=4), begin=20306, end=20312, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: In the immediate foreground , the green waters break soothingly upon a pebbly beach , or fall in crested waves .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=20479, end=20486, entitycategory=NAT_LANDFORM), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=20469, end=20478, sentimentcategory=4), begin=20479, end=20486, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: On the right and left recede into distance the deeply indented shores , here clothed with luxuriant forests , there bare and precipitous .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=20479, end=20486, entitycategory=NAT_LANDFORM), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=20495, end=20515, sentimentcategory=2), begin=20479, end=20486, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: On the right and left recede into distance the deeply indented shores , here clothed with luxuriant forests , there bare and precipitous .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=20818, end=20838, entitycategory=LOCATION), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=20788, end=20810, sentimentcategory=4), begin=20818, end=20838, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: Yonder , nineteen miles away , is Granite Point , rising perpendicularly from the water 724 feet , with Granite Mountain behind it , towering 5,300 feet above the level of the lake , itself surmounted by the snowy peaks of Pack Saddle Mountain , and they , in turn , by the great purple range of the C [ oe ] ur d'Alènes .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=21082, end=21091, entitycategory=NAT_LANDFORM), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=21098, end=21105, sentimentcategory=4), begin=21082, end=21091, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: It is , however , if possible , even finer , the mountains being loftier , and the forests more luxuriant , than those inclosing the hitherto unrivaled lake in Northern New York .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=21116, end=21123, entitycategory=NAT_LANDFORM), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=21124, end=21138, sentimentcategory=4), begin=21116, end=21123, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: It is , however , if possible , even finer , the mountains being loftier , and the forests more luxuriant , than those inclosing the hitherto unrivaled lake in Northern New York .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=21185, end=21189, entitycategory=NAT_LANDFORM), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=21175, end=21184, sentimentcategory=4), begin=21185, end=21189, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: It is , however , if possible , even finer , the mountains being loftier , and the forests more luxuriant , than those inclosing the hitherto unrivaled lake in Northern New York .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=21566, end=21573, entitycategory=NAT_LANDFORM), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=21524, end=21555, sentimentcategory=4), begin=21566, end=21573, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: Nowhere , probably , in the United States , is there such an abundance of large game as in the forests of Northwestern Montana and Northern Idaho .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=21819, end=21824, entitycategory=FAUNA), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=21851, end=21860, sentimentcategory=4), begin=21819, end=21824, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: Of winged game , geese , ducks and partridge are plentiful , and they may be shot at any season of the year .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=21827, end=21832, entitycategory=FAUNA), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=21851, end=21860, sentimentcategory=4), begin=21827, end=21832, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: Of winged game , geese , ducks and partridge are plentiful , and they may be shot at any season of the year .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=21837, end=21846, entitycategory=FAUNA), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=21851, end=21860, sentimentcategory=4), begin=21837, end=21846, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: Of winged game , geese , ducks and partridge are plentiful , and they may be shot at any season of the year .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=22345, end=22353, entitycategory=LOCATION), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=22283, end=22335, sentimentcategory=4), begin=22345, end=22353, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: Various applications have been made to the Northern Pacific Railroad Company , by local hunters , for special rates for the shipment of game East ; but the Company has steadfastly refused to encourage the wholesale destruction of game for commercial purposes , preferring that it should be reserved for legitimate sport . [ Illustration : LAKE PEND D'OREILLE , IDAHO . ] The true sportsman will immensely enjoy an excursion into the Kootenai country .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=22792, end=22796, entitycategory=FAUNA), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=22787, end=22791, sentimentcategory=4), begin=22792, end=22796, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: That the waters of Clark 's Fork and Lake Pend d'Oreille are full of fine fish of many varieties , is established by overwhelming testimony .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=23752, end=23762, entitycategory=FAUNA), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=23788, end=23835, sentimentcategory=2), begin=23752, end=23762, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: The `` squaw fish '' is said to be gamey , but of comparatively little value for the table .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=24208, end=24213, entitycategory=FAUNA), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=24217, end=24267, sentimentcategory=2), begin=24208, end=24213, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: At Heron , which , by the way , is a divisional terminus of the railroad , with a first-class hotel operated in connection with the dining car department , trout is said to be so abundant as to be thought nothing of ; `` grayling , '' sometimes reaching ten pounds in weight , are almost as plentiful ; and it is said to be no uncommon thing to see them jumping out of the water , pursued by large whitefish .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=25055, end=25060, entitycategory=FAUNA), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=25075, end=25096, sentimentcategory=5), begin=25055, end=25060, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: From about the middle of August until the snow flies , the trout fishing is `` the best in the world . '' There is also a fish resembling the herring , found in one part of the lake in immense shoals .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=25368, end=25381, entitycategory=LOCATION), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=25358, end=25367, sentimentcategory=4), begin=25368, end=25381, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: Soon after leaving Lake Pend d'Oreille , the line enters a dense forest containing few settlements , and little that is interesting or picturesque , beyond the beautiful Lake Cocolala , a long but narrow sheet of water on the north side of the track .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=25690, end=25698, entitycategory=NAT_LANDFORM), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=25638, end=25682, sentimentcategory=4), begin=25690, end=25698, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: This lake even rivals , in the beauty of its waters and the grandeur of its mountain scenery , its more accessible neighbor , Lake Pend d'Oreille , while its conveniences for boating and fishing are equally good .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=25740, end=25759, entitycategory=LOCATION), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=25762, end=25825, sentimentcategory=4), begin=25740, end=25759, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: This lake even rivals , in the beauty of its waters and the grandeur of its mountain scenery , its more accessible neighbor , Lake Pend d'Oreille , while its conveniences for boating and fishing are equally good .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=25969, end=25982, entitycategory=NAT_LANDFORM), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=25963, end=25968, sentimentcategory=4), begin=25969, end=25982, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: At the station of Idaho Line , the train enters the Territory of Washington , pursuing its way in a southwesterly direction across the great Spokane Plain .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=26013, end=26026, entitycategory=HUM_LANDFORM), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=26031, end=26101, sentimentcategory=4), begin=26013, end=26026, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: A short run , and we are at Spokane Falls , a bright and busy little city , charmingly situated on the Spokane river , near the celebrated falls from which it takes its name .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=26124, end=26129, entitycategory=NAT_LANDFORM), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=26113, end=26123, sentimentcategory=4), begin=26124, end=26129, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: A short run , and we are at Spokane Falls , a bright and busy little city , charmingly situated on the Spokane river , near the celebrated falls from which it takes its name .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=26261, end=26266, entitycategory=NAT_LANDFORM), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=26241, end=26260, sentimentcategory=4), begin=26261, end=26266, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: Built upon a gravelly plateau , sloping gently toward the river , overlooked by beautiful pine-clad hills , and with lofty mountain ranges in the far distance , Spokane Falls can not but produce a favorable impression upon the passing traveler .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=26284, end=26292, entitycategory=NAT_LANDFORM), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=26278, end=26283, sentimentcategory=4), begin=26284, end=26292, linktype=sentiment_of)

_sentence_text: Built upon a gravelly plateau , sloping gently toward the river , overlooked by beautiful pine-clad hills , and with lofty mountain ranges in the far distance , Spokane Falls can not but produce a favorable impression upon the passing traveler .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=26411, end=26416, entitycategory=NAT_LANDFORM), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=26433, end=26457, sentimentcategory=4), begin=26411, end=26416, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: Its falls , which are its chief natural attraction , and will be the secret of the great commercial and manufacturing importance that undoubtedly awaits it , are situated on the north side of the town .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=26411, end=26416, entitycategory=NAT_LANDFORM), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=26464, end=26562, sentimentcategory=4), begin=26411, end=26416, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: Its falls , which are its chief natural attraction , and will be the secret of the great commercial and manufacturing importance that undoubtedly awaits it , are situated on the north side of the town .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=1112, end=1119, entitycategory=PERSON), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=1163, end=1168), begin=1112, end=1119, linktype=refers_to)
_sentence_text: Unser langer Aufenthalt in dem Gebiete der Macusis , unser fast ununter- brochener Umgang mit ihnen hatte uns natürlich nicht allein mit ihren Sitten , Ge- bräuchen und ihrer Sprache genauer bekannt , sondern auch mit ihrem Charakter vertrauter gemacht , was hei den übrigen Stämmen nicht der Fall sein konnte , da wir meistens bloss Tage , selten länger als einige Wochen unter ihnen weilten , ihre Sprache uns fast ganz unverständlich blieb , und wir daher meist auch nur das von ihrem Gesammtleben kennen lernten , was uns gerade erfahrungsmässig entgegen- trat ; obschon sich bereits aus diesem Wenigen das als unzweifelhafte Thatsache herausstellte , dass , wie die Bewohner Süd-Amerika ’ s in ihrer Körperbildung nur wenig von einander abweichen , so auch ihre geistigen Fähigkeiten , ihr Charakter , den Hauptziigen nach , ziemlich mit einander iibereinstimmen .

_sentence_text: Dass die Macusis jetzt noch zu den zahlreichsten und mächtigsten Stämmen von Bri tisch - Guiana gehören , dass sie die Savannen zwischen dem Rupununi , Parima , längs dem Pacaraiina und CW^A ’ ^-Gebirge , in einer Anzahl von etwa 1500 Seelen bewohnen , während der Gesammtstamm ungefähr 3000 Individuen betragen mag , habe ich bereits erwähnt , eben so , dass sich der Stamm durch seinen friedliebenden , gefälligen , milden und freundlichen Charakter , besonders aber durch die so seltene Eigenschaft der Ordnungsliebe und Reinlichkeit auszeichnet .

_sentence_text: Buffon entwirft folgende Charakteristik der Bewohner Süd-Amerika 's : `` Ob- schon der Wilde Amerika ’ s seinen natürlichen Anlagen nach mit dem Menschen der civilisirten Welt übereinslimmt , so entkräftet dieses doch nicht den Einwurf gegen die allgemeine Verkümmerung des thierischen Organismus in jenem Erdtheile .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=NULL, begin=3080, end=3102, entitycategory=PERSON, sentimentcategory=1), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=3052, end=3075, sentimentcategory=1), begin=3080, end=3102, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: Buffon entwirft folgende Charakteristik der Bewohner Süd-Amerika 's : `` Ob- schon der Wilde Amerika ’ s seinen natürlichen Anlagen nach mit dem Menschen der civilisirten Welt übereinslimmt , so entkräftet dieses doch nicht den Einwurf gegen die allgemeine Verkümmerung des thierischen Organismus in jenem Erdtheile .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=NULL, begin=3132, end=3138, entitycategory=PERSON, sentimentcategory=1), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=3148, end=3180, sentimentcategory=1), begin=3132, end=3138, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: Bei den Wilden sind die Zeugungsorgane klein und schwach ; ihm fehlt der Bart und die leidenschaftliche Liebe gegen das Weib .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=4961, end=4983, entitycategory=WEATHER), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=5020, end=5050, sentimentcategory=2), begin=4961, end=4983, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: The night was quite frosty , and when I awoke in the morning , my limbs were numbed with cold .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=9082, end=9087, entitycategory=PERSON), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=9065, end=9069, sentimentcategory=4), begin=9082, end=9087, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: I felt that he was in good hands , and that his kind Californian nurse and her husband would do all that they could for him .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=11140, end=11147, entitycategory=PERSON), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=11357, end=11415, sentimentcategory=2), begin=11140, end=11147, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: Open attempts at robbery were rare ; it was in the stealthy night time that thieves prowled about , and , entering the little tents , occupied by not more than perhaps a couple of miners , neither of whom , in all probability , felt inclined to keep a weary watch over their golden treasure , carried off as much of it as they could lay their hands on .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=12209, end=12215, entitycategory=PERSON), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=12216, end=12232, sentimentcategory=2), begin=12209, end=12215, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: Clothing of any description is hardly to be had at any price , and the majority of the miners go about in rags .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=12345, end=12357, entitycategory=PERSON), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=12338, end=12344, sentimentcategory=2), begin=12345, end=12357, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: I saw a group of ragged gold-diggers , the greater part of them suffering from fever , paying this exorbitant price for glass after glass of the fiery spirit , every drop of which they consumed was only aggravating their illness , and , in all probability , bringing them one step nearer to their grave .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=12639, end=12647, entitycategory=PERSON), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=12720, end=12765, sentimentcategory=2), begin=12639, end=12647, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: The big bony American , who treated Lacosse and the trapper in such a peremptory manner , and who seemed to be the terror of these diggings , was pointed out to me .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=12639, end=12647, entitycategory=PERSON), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=12630, end=12638, sentimentcategory=4), begin=12639, end=12647, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: The big bony American , who treated Lacosse and the trapper in such a peremptory manner , and who seemed to be the terror of these diggings , was pointed out to me .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=13339, end=13346, entitycategory=PERSON), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=13332, end=13338, sentimentcategory=2), begin=13339, end=13346, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: The men he had shot , it seems , were common thieves -- one , a deserter from the garrison at Monterey , and the other belonging to a similar band of robbers to that by which our party had been attacked , and our gold carried off .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=13444, end=13451, entitycategory=PERSON), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=13460, end=13496, sentimentcategory=2), begin=13444, end=13451, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: The men he had shot , it seems , were common thieves -- one , a deserter from the garrison at Monterey , and the other belonging to a similar band of robbers to that by which our party had been attacked , and our gold carried off .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=13536, end=13550, entitycategory=HUM_LANDFORM), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=13570, end=13639, sentimentcategory=4), begin=13536, end=13550, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: I reached Sutter 's Fort the next day , and found it like the most crowded localities of some of our great cities , with the exception that the bulk of the people we met with belonged to a totally different race .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=16066, end=16076, entitycategory=PERSON), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=16085, end=16190, sentimentcategory=2), begin=16066, end=16076, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: They had constant tidings of them all along the route , as El Capitan was too well known to many a poor ranchero whom he had plundered of the dollars produced by the sale of his hides , while on his journey home from the sea-coast .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=16111, end=16119, entitycategory=PERSON), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=16106, end=16110, sentimentcategory=2), begin=16111, end=16119, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: They had constant tidings of them all along the route , as El Capitan was too well known to many a poor ranchero whom he had plundered of the dollars produced by the sale of his hides , while on his journey home from the sea-coast .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=17871, end=17877, entitycategory=FAUNA), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=17865, end=17870, sentimentcategory=4), begin=17871, end=17877, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: We obtained fresh horses from Sweeting , and set off in gallant style , determined to shorten the distance by hard riding .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=18824, end=18831, entitycategory=PERSON), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=18832, end=18857, sentimentcategory=2), begin=18824, end=18831, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: Don Luis and myself , after having dispatched Lacosse to communicate this intelligence to Bradley and McPhail , sought an interview with Colonel Mason , and , on informing him of the robbery and the circumstances attending it , received from him an order to see the soldier who was then under arrest .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=20849, end=20856, entitycategory=PERSON), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=20839, end=20848, sentimentcategory=4), begin=20849, end=20856, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: The following morning we fell in with some civilized Indians , who informed us , in answer to our inquiries , that a party of three whites passed along the trail the evening before last , and that they would have encamped not far from this spot .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=21730, end=21738, entitycategory=PERSON), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=21725, end=21729, sentimentcategory=2), begin=21730, end=21738, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: This is , to make predatory excursions across the mountains , and to drive off a large herd of tame horses , belonging to some poor ranchero , at a time ; these they slaughter , and subsist on as long as the flesh lasts , when they set out again on a similar expedition .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=22328, end=22331, entitycategory=FAUNA), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=22383, end=22431, sentimentcategory=2), begin=22328, end=22331, linktype=sentiment_of)

_sentence_text: The march to Pedong was an easy one of 14 miles with a gentle climb of 3,000 feet followed by a descent of 2,000 feet past gardens beautiful with their great trees of scarlet hibiscus , daturas and bougainvilleas , which grew with wonderful luxuriance in this climate where frost is almost unknown in winter and where in summer the temperature scarcely ever exceeds 85° Fahrenheit .

_sentence_text: At Pedong there were more wonderful daturas , and all along the next march we kept passing grand bushes of these flowers .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=14903, end=14912, entitycategory=WEATHER), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=14913, end=14957, sentimentcategory=2), begin=14903, end=14912, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: It rained all that night and most of the following day , so that we had a very wet and trying march to Rongli -- the distance was only 12 miles , but this included a very steep descent of over 3,000 feet to the bottom of a steamy valley , followed by a climb of 3,000 feet across an intervening ridge and then down another 2,000 feet to the Rongli bungalow .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=15572, end=15578, entitycategory=FLORA), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=15555, end=15571, sentimentcategory=4), begin=15572, end=15578, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: On the way Wollaston and I stopped at Rhenock to have a look at the Chandra Nursery kept by Tulsi Dass , where there were many interesting plants , chiefly collected in the Sikkim forests .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=15635, end=15639, entitycategory=FLORA), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=15640, end=15693, sentimentcategory=4), begin=15635, end=15639, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: There was a tree growing everywhere in the forests with a white flower which Sikkim people called Chilauni , and all along the paths the Sikkim durbar had been busy planting mulberry , walnut and toon trees .

_sentence_text: There was a curious pink ground plant that grew in the forests which I was told belonged to the Amomum species .

_sentence_text: There were also beautiful orchids in the trees , mauve , white and yellow , belonging to the Dendrobium , Coelogene and Cymbidium families -- some with fine sprays of flowers 18 inches long .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=16156, end=16161, entitycategory=FAUNA), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=16167, end=16175, sentimentcategory=1), begin=16156, end=16161, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: Here at Rongli the mules were so tired that we had to give them a day 's rest before they could go on any further .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=16425, end=16430, entitycategory=FAUNA), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=16441, end=16445, sentimentcategory=2), begin=16425, end=16430, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: It was a hot and feverish spot to stop in , and only necessity compelled us to do so , as we were unable to get any extra transport the following morning to supplement the mules that were sick .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=16695, end=16704, entitycategory=PERSON), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=16773, end=16817, sentimentcategory=5), begin=16695, end=16704, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: The dark faces of the muleteers with their turquoise earrings formed a pretty picture and they were full of friendly smiles and greetings for us .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=16695, end=16704, entitycategory=PERSON), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=16744, end=16758, sentimentcategory=4), begin=16695, end=16704, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: The dark faces of the muleteers with their turquoise earrings formed a pretty picture and they were full of friendly smiles and greetings for us .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=17223, end=17234, entitycategory=FAUNA), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=17201, end=17217, sentimentcategory=2), begin=17223, end=17234, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: I rode up to see how they were getting on , and found they were having the same trouble with their mules that we had been having .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=17425, end=17442, entitycategory=FLORA), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=17412, end=17424, sentimentcategory=4), begin=17425, end=17442, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: Sedongchen is the old local name , so-called because there once grew there a very large `` Sedong '' tree .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=17455, end=17459, entitycategory=FLORA), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=17460, end=17534, sentimentcategory=1), begin=17455, end=17459, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: This is a tree that has a white sap which irritates the skin intensely and sets up a rash .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=17606, end=17611, entitycategory=NAT_LANDFORM), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=17595, end=17605, sentimentcategory=1), begin=17606, end=17611, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: Sedongchen was only 9 miles from Rongli , but there was a very steep climb , from 2,700 feet up to 7,000 feet , and our mules only just managed to arrive there .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=17653, end=17662, entitycategory=FAUNA), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=17663, end=17696, sentimentcategory=1), begin=17653, end=17662, linktype=sentiment_of)

_sentence_text: The first part of the way is alongside the rushing stream of the Rongli , through lovely woods and dense tropical vegetation .

_sentence_text: Here , too , were magnificent forest trees , fully 150 feet high , with clean straight trunks and without a branch for a hundred feet ; others nearly equally tall , which the Sikkim people call `` Panisage , '' had huge buttresses and trunks nearly 40 feet in circumference .

_sentence_text: For the first time since leaving Darjeeling the sun shone , and after we left the forests we found the uphill climb very hot .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=18517, end=18522, entitycategory=NAT_LANDFORM), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=18510, end=18516, sentimentcategory=2), begin=18517, end=18522, linktype=sentiment_of)

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=18572, end=18577, entitycategory=FAUNA), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=18709, end=18713, entitycategory=FAUNA), begin=18572, end=18577, linktype=refers_to)
_sentence_text: On to-day 's march , out of the fifty mules with which we started there were only fourteen carrying our own kit , and of those fourteen we found on arrival at Sedongchen that none would be fit to proceed on the following day .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=18709, end=18713, entitycategory=FAUNA), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=18714, end=18758, sentimentcategory=2), begin=18709, end=18713, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: On to-day 's march , out of the fifty mules with which we started there were only fourteen carrying our own kit , and of those fourteen we found on arrival at Sedongchen that none would be fit to proceed on the following day .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=18835, end=18855, entitycategory=FAUNA), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=18761, end=18834, sentimentcategory=1), begin=18835, end=18855, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: It was therefore with great reluctance that I felt compelled to send back the Government mules , as they could not only not carry their own line gear , but had become an extra and very large source of expense and worry to us .

_sentence_text: That the mules should have completely broken down like this after a five days ' march showed that they must have been in no kind of training and condition and were completely unfitted for heavy work in the mountains .

_sentence_text: At Sedongchen there was a pleasant bungalow , rather Swiss in appearance , with fine views down the Rongli Valley and across all the forest ridges over which we had come , right back to Darjeeling .

_sentence_text: CHAPTER II THE CHUMBI VALLEY AND THE TIBETAN PLATEAU The range of mountains which here forms the boundary between Sikkim and Tibet runs nearly North and South , and the two main passes across it are the Jelep La and the Nathu La , the latter being a few miles to the North of the Jelep La and about the same height .

_sentence_text: The years 1777 & 1778 exhibited only a larger number occasionally employed and for their fidelity and attachment to Government they were invaded in 1779 by a rebel army reported to be from 5 to 600 men with a train of Artillery who forced them to retire to Niagara leaving behind them very fine plantations of corn and vegetables , with their cloathing , arms , silver works , Wampum Kettles and Implements of Husbandry , the collection of ages of which were distroyed in a deliberate manner and march of the rebels .

_annotation: w.c.Link(Dependent=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=ASPECT, begin=19568, end=19576, entitycategory=PERSON), Governor=w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=SENTIMENT, begin=19645, end=19664, sentimentcategory=4), begin=19568, end=19576, linktype=sentiment_of)
_sentence_text: Colonel Johnson thereupon issued the best orders he could devise for the preventing abuses and the better regulation of matters relating to goods payment of expenses , and proceeding to the discharge of the principal objects of his duty , he , accordingly to a plan long since proposed , formed the Indians into Companies and by degrees taught them to feel the convenience of having officers set apart to each , which they were soon not only reconciled to but highly pleased with , by which means he gave some degree of method and form to the most Independent race of the Indians , greatly facilitated all business with them and by a prudent arrangement of his officers those who were before uninformed became in a little time some of the most approved and usefull persons in his department , being constantly quartered at such places or sent on some services as tended most to their improvement and the public advantage , whilst by spiriting up and employing the Indians with constant party's along the frontiers from Fort Stanwix to Fort Pitt he so harrassed the back settlements , as finally to drive numbers of them from their plantation destroying their houses , mills , graneries , & c , frequently defeating their scouting parties killing and captivating many of their people amounting in the whole to near 900 and all this with few or no instances of savage cruelty exclusive of what they performed when assisted by His Majesty 's Troops as will appear from his returns .

_sentence_text: The merchants have since been accused of fraud by a clerk who lived some time with them , the investigation of which he was called suddenly to attend and he now finds that many articles undoubtedly issued have been placed to his account instead of their [ the ] Crown , and many false and malicious insinuations circulated to the prejudice of his character and his influence with the Indians which is rendered the more injurious by his abrupt departure from the shortness of the time , which did not permit his calling and explaining to the chiefs the reasons for his leaving them as [ he ] undoubtedly should have done , and therefore , and on every public account , his presence is not only effected [ expected ] , but is become more necessary among them than ever .

précautions un filet en mailles de soie bleue, on vend aussi des parures
anciennes, en argent ou en or, en pierreries vraies ou fausses, et

blanc percé de deux trous qui masque le visage des femmes.

_sentence_text: Famous now because there Fra Lippo Lippi lived , and there Masolino and Masaccio painted , it is in itself one of the most meretricious and worthless buildings of the eighteenth century , full of every sort of flamboyant ornament and insincere , uncalled-for decoration ; and yet , in spite of every vulgarity , how spacious it is , as though even in that evil hour the Latin genius could not wholly forget its delight in space and light .

_sentence_text: Yesterday we marched through narrow defiles and along hillsides to this lake , without seeing a tent , a man , or even a sheep or goat , following a stream which bears several names and receives several torrents which burst , full grown , from powerful springs in the mountain sides -- a frequent phenomenon in this country -- from its source till its entrance into this lake .

_sentence_text: On the right bank rise the magnificent ranges which form Shuturun , broken up into precipices , deep ravines , and peaks , all rocky and shapely , and absolutely denuded of soil .

_sentence_text: We had written to bespeak a room with fire in it , and this was well , for the hotel was otherwise heated only by the bodies of its frequenters , who , when filled with Chianti , might emit a sensible warmth ; though it was very modern in being lighted with electricity , and having a lift , in which , after a tepid supper , we were carried to our apartment .

_annotation: w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=NULL, begin=6675, end=6691, entitycategory=PERSON, sentimentcategory=3)
_sentence_text: We had our landlord 's company at supper , and had learned from him that the most eminent of American financiers , who shall not otherwise be identified here , was in the habit , when coming to Leghorn , of letting him know that he was bringing a party of friends , and commanding of him a banquet such as he alone knew how to furnish a millionaire of that princely quality .

_annotation: w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=NULL, begin=6765, end=6776, entitycategory=PERSON, sentimentcategory=3)
_sentence_text: We had our landlord 's company at supper , and had learned from him that the most eminent of American financiers , who shall not otherwise be identified here , was in the habit , when coming to Leghorn , of letting him know that he was bringing a party of friends , and commanding of him a banquet such as he alone knew how to furnish a millionaire of that princely quality .

_annotation: w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=NULL, begin=6881, end=6892, entitycategory=PERSON, sentimentcategory=2)
_sentence_text: After that we were not so much surprised as grieved to find that our elderly chambermaid had profited by our absence to gather all the coals out of our one stove into two scaldini , which were bristling before her where she knelt when we opened the door upon her .

_annotation: w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=NULL, begin=8370, end=8378, entitycategory=WEATHER, sentimentcategory=2)
_sentence_text: But , even with these heaping the hotel blankets and com-forters , we shivered , and a superannuated odor that had lurked in the recesses of those rooms , to which the sun or wind had never pierced , grew with the growing cold , and haunted the night like something palpable as well as sensible - the materialization of smells dead and buried there long ago .

_annotation: w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=NULL, begin=8835, end=8841, entitycategory=PERSON, sentimentcategory=3)
_sentence_text: It was wonderful how little way the electric bulb shed its beams in that naughty air ; it would not even light the page which at one time was opened in the vain hope that the author would help the benumbing cold to bring torpor if not slumber to the weary brain .

_annotation: w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=NULL, begin=9309, end=9317, entitycategory=PERSON, sentimentcategory=3)
_sentence_text: It is really impossible to say where or how we breakfasted , but it was somehow managed , and then search was made by the swiftest conveyance for the hotel which we had heard of outside the city , as helping make Leghorn the watering-place it is for Italians in the summer , and in the winter as being steam-heated and appointed with every modern comfort for the passing or sojourning stranger .

_annotation: w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=NULL, begin=9515, end=9522, entitycategory=PERSON, sentimentcategory=3)
_sentence_text: But perhaps it is as well not ; if I did , all my readers would swarm upon that hotel , and there would be no room for me , who hope some day to go back there and spend an old age of luxurious leisure .

_annotation: w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=NULL, begin=10297, end=10310, entitycategory=PERSON, sentimentcategory=2)
_sentence_text: We had become not only agnostic as respected the possibility of warmth in Leghorn , we were open sceptics , aggressive infidels .

_annotation: w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=NULL, begin=10313, end=10332, entitycategory=PERSON, sentimentcategory=2)
_sentence_text: We had become not only agnostic as respected the possibility of warmth in Leghorn , we were open sceptics , aggressive infidels .

_annotation: w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=NULL, begin=10940, end=10948, entitycategory=PERSON, sentimentcategory=2)
_sentence_text: Our daily return for what we got was a poor twelve francs each ; but fancy a haughty American landlord caressing us with such sweet and reassuring civility for any sum of money !

_annotation: w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=NULL, begin=11190, end=11196, entitycategory=PERSON, sentimentcategory=3)
_sentence_text: Those gentle people made themselves our friends ; there was nothing they would not do , or try to do , for us , in the vast , pink palace where we were never twenty guests together , and mostly eight or ten , with the run of a reading-room where there were the latest papers and periodicals from London and Paris , and with a kitchen whence we were served the best luncheons and dinners we ate in Europe .

_annotation: w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=NULL, begin=11742, end=11750, entitycategory=PERSON, sentimentcategory=3)
_sentence_text: There were two stately dining-rooms besides the one where we dined , and there were pleasant spaces where we had afternoon tea or after-dinner coffee , and from which a magnificent stairway ascended to the upper halls , and a quiet lift waited our orders , with the landlord or his son to take us up ; and so lonely and quiet and gentle , with porters and chambermaids speaking beautiful Tuscan , and watchful attendants everywhere prophesying and fulfilling our wants .

_annotation: w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=NULL, begin=12199, end=12207, entitycategory=PERSON, sentimentcategory=3)
_sentence_text: Outside , the environment flattered or rewarded us with a garden of laurel and other evergreens , and with flower-beds where the annuals were beginning to show the gardener 's designs in their sprouting seeds .

_annotation: w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=NULL, begin=13689, end=13696, entitycategory=PERSON, sentimentcategory=3)
_sentence_text: In compensation there was , toward the city , near the ship-yards where the great Italian battle-ships are built , the statue of their builder - a man who looked it - standing at large ease , with one hand in his pantaloons pocket , and not apparently conscious of the passer 's gaze .

_annotation: w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=NULL, begin=835, end=850, entitycategory=ORGANISATION, sentimentcategory=4)
_sentence_text: Every one knows the story of the Horatii and the Curiatii : how these hapless brothers and cousins fought in sight of both armies with a bravery worthy of the stake ; and how , at length , when two of the Roman heroes were slain , and all the Albans were wounded , the third Roman , who was unhurt , feigned to fly , and thus separating his enemies , who followed him as well as their failing strength would permit , easily despatched them one after the other , and thus gained the victory for the Roman cause .

_sentence_text: Here Commodus , the base son of a heroic father , practised those lusts and brutalities which have branded his name as that of one of the most unmitigated monsters that ever stained the pages of history .

_annotation: w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=NULL, begin=9795, end=9806, entitycategory=FLORA, sentimentcategory=4)

_sentence_text: Doubtless with a sad and pitying heart , he would be led by the cohort of soldiers along the street of tombs , then the most crowded approach to a city of nearly two millions of souls ; tombs whose massiveness and solidity were but a vain craving for immortality , and whose epitaphs were the most deeply touching of all epitaphs , on account of the profound despair with which they bade their eternal farewell .

_annotation: w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=NULL, begin=20835, end=20849, entitycategory=PERSON, sentimentcategory=4)
_sentence_text: He had a deeper yearning for the Gentiles , because he thus beheld with his own eyes the places associated with the darkest aspects of paganism ; the scenes that gave rise to the pagan ideas of heaven and hell ; the splendid temples in which the human soul had debased itself to objects beneath the dignity of its own nature , and thus prepared itself for all moral corruption ; and the massive sepulchral monuments in which the hopeless despair of heathenism had , as it were , become petrified by the Gorgon gaze of death .

_annotation: w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=NULL, begin=21225, end=21241, entitycategory=ORGANISATION, sentimentcategory=5)
_sentence_text: That Appian Way should be to us the most interesting of all the roads of the world ; for by it came to us our civilisation and Christianity - the divine principles and hopes that redeem the soul , retrieve the vanity of existence , open up the path of life through the dark valley of death , and disclose the glorious vista of immortality beyond the tomb .

text: the feet of them that preach
_sentence_text: And as we gaze upon the remains of that road , and feel how much we owe to it as the material channel of God 's grace to us who were far off , we can say with deepest gratitude of those apostles and martyrs who once walked on this lava pavement , but are now standing on the sea of glass before the throne , `` How beautiful are the feet of them that preach the gospel of peace , and bring glad tidings of good things !

_annotation: w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=NULL, begin=22291, end=22316, entitycategory=ORGANISATION, sentimentcategory=2)
_sentence_text: In this bluff promontory the Holy Land reaches out , as it were , towards the Western World ; and like a tie-stone that projects from the gable of the first of a row of houses , indicating that other buildings are to be added , it shows that the inheritance of Israel was not meant to be always exclusive , but was destined to comprehend all the countries which its faith should annex .

_annotation: w.c.Emotions_Entities(ASP_SENT_NULL=NULL, begin=22555, end=22581, entitycategory=NAT_LANDFORM, sentimentcategory=4)
